94/*%
95 * Choose the most preferable multiplex method.

97#if defined(HAVE_KQUEUE)
98#define USE_KQUEUE
99#elif defined(HAVE_EPOLL_CREATE1)
100#define USE_EPOLL
101#elif defined(HAVE_SYS_DEVPOLL_H) || defined(HAVE_DEVPOLL_H)
102#define USE_DEVPOLL
103typedef struct {
104 unsigned int want_read : 1,
105 want_write : 1;
106} pollinfo_t;
107#else
108#define USE_SELECT
109#endif /* HAVE_KQUEUE */

111/*
112 * Set by the -T dscp option on the command line. If set to a value
113 * other than -1, we check to make sure DSCP values match it, and
114 * assert if not.
115 */
116int isc_dscp_check_value = -1;

118/*%
119 * Maximum number of allowable open sockets. This is also the maximum
120 * allowable socket file descriptor.
121 *
122 * Care should be taken before modifying this value for select():
123 * The API standard doesn't ensure select() accept more than (the system default
124 * of) FD_SETSIZE descriptors, and the default size should in fact be fine in
125 * the vast majority of cases. This constant should therefore be increased only
126 * when absolutely necessary and possible, i.e., the server is exhausting all
127 * available file descriptors (up to FD_SETSIZE) and the select() function
128 * and FD_xxx macros support larger values than FD_SETSIZE (which may not
129 * always by true, but we keep using some of them to ensure as much
130 * portability as possible). Note also that overall server performance
131 * may be rather worsened with a larger value of this constant due to
132 * inherent scalability problems of select().
133 *
134 * As a special note, this value shouldn't have to be touched if
135 * this is a build for an authoritative only DNS server.
136 */
137#ifndef ISC_SOCKET_MAXSOCKETS
138#if defined(USE_KQUEUE) || defined(USE_EPOLL) || defined(USE_DEVPOLL)
139#ifdef TUNE_LARGE
140#define ISC_SOCKET_MAXSOCKETS 21000
141#else
142#define ISC_SOCKET_MAXSOCKETS 4096
143#endif /* TUNE_LARGE */
144#elif defined(USE_SELECT)
145#define ISC_SOCKET_MAXSOCKETS FD_SETSIZE
146#endif /* USE_KQUEUE... */
147#endif /* ISC_SOCKET_MAXSOCKETS */
148
149#ifdef USE_SELECT
150/*%
151 * Mac OS X needs a special definition to support larger values in select().
152 * We always define this because a larger value can be specified run-time.
153 */
154#ifdef __APPLE__
155#define _DARWIN_UNLIMITED_SELECT
156#endif /* __APPLE__ */
157#endif /* USE_SELECT */
158
159#ifdef ISC_SOCKET_USE_POLLWATCH
160/*%
161 * If this macro is defined, enable workaround for a Solaris /dev/poll kernel
162 * bug: DP_POLL ioctl could keep sleeping even if socket I/O is possible for
163 * some of the specified FD. The idea is based on the observation that it's
164 * likely for a busy server to keep receiving packets. It specifically works
165 * as follows: the socket watcher is first initialized with the state of
166 * "poll_idle". While it's in the idle state it keeps sleeping until a socket
167 * event occurs. When it wakes up for a socket I/O event, it moves to the
168 * poll_active state, and sets the poll timeout to a short period
169 * (ISC_SOCKET_POLLWATCH_TIMEOUT msec). If timeout occurs in this state, the
170 * watcher goes to the poll_checking state with the same timeout period.
171 * In this state, the watcher tries to detect whether this is a break
172 * during intermittent events or the kernel bug is triggered. If the next
173 * polling reports an event within the short period, the previous timeout is
174 * likely to be a kernel bug, and so the watcher goes back to the active state.
175 * Otherwise, it moves to the idle state again.
176 *
177 * It's not clear whether this is a thread-related bug, but since we've only
178 * seen this with threads, this workaround is used only when enabling threads.
179 */
180
181typedef enum { poll_idle, poll_active, poll_checking } pollstate_t;
182
183#ifndef ISC_SOCKET_POLLWATCH_TIMEOUT
184#define ISC_SOCKET_POLLWATCH_TIMEOUT 10
185#endif /* ISC_SOCKET_POLLWATCH_TIMEOUT */
186#endif /* ISC_SOCKET_USE_POLLWATCH */
187
188/*%
189 * Per-FD lock buckets, we shuffle them around a bit as FDs come in herds.
190 */
191#define FDLOCK_BITS 10
192#define FDLOCK_COUNT (1<<FDLOCK_BITS)
193#define FDLOCK_ID(fd) (((fd)%(FDLOCK_COUNT)>>(FDLOCK_BITS/2)) |\
194 (((fd)<<(FDLOCK_BITS/2))%(FDLOCK_COUNT)))
195
196/*%
197 * Maximum number of events communicated with the kernel. There should normally
198 * be no need for having a large number.
199 */
200#if defined(USE_KQUEUE) || defined(USE_EPOLL) || defined(USE_DEVPOLL)
201#ifndef ISC_SOCKET_MAXEVENTS
202#ifdef TUNE_LARGE
203#define ISC_SOCKET_MAXEVENTS 2048
204#else
205#define ISC_SOCKET_MAXEVENTS 64
206#endif /* TUNE_LARGE */
207#endif
208#endif

210/*%
211 * Some systems define the socket length argument as an int, some as size_t,
212 * some as socklen_t. This is here so it can be easily changed if needed.
213 */
214#ifndef socklen_t
215#define socklen_t unsigned int
216#endif

218/*%
219 * Define what the possible "soft" errors can be. These are non-fatal returns
220 * of various network related functions, like recv() and so on.
221 *
222 * For some reason, BSDI (and perhaps others) will sometimes return <0
223 * from recv() but will have errno==0. This is broken, but we have to
224 * work around it here.
225 */
226#define SOFT_ERROR(e) ((e) == EAGAIN || \
227 (e) == EWOULDBLOCK || \
228 (e) == ENOBUFS || \
229 (e) == EINTR || \
230 (e) == ENOBUFS || \
231 (e) == 0)
232
233#define DLVL(x) ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL, ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(x)
234
235/*!<
236 * DLVL(90) -- Function entry/exit and other tracing.
237 * DLVL(70) -- Socket "correctness" -- including returning of events, etc.
238 * DLVL(60) -- Socket data send/receive
239 * DLVL(50) -- Event tracing, including receiving/sending completion events.
240 * DLVL(20) -- Socket creation/destruction.
241 */
242#define TRACE_LEVEL 90
243#define CORRECTNESS_LEVEL 70
244#define IOEVENT_LEVEL 60
245#define EVENT_LEVEL 50
246#define CREATION_LEVEL 20
247
248#define TRACE DLVL(TRACE_LEVEL)
249#define CORRECTNESS DLVL(CORRECTNESS_LEVEL)
250#define IOEVENT DLVL(IOEVENT_LEVEL)
251#define EVENT DLVL(EVENT_LEVEL)
252#define CREATION DLVL(CREATION_LEVEL)

268/*%
269 * NetBSD and FreeBSD can timestamp packets. XXXMLG Should we have
270 * a setsockopt() like interface to request timestamps, and if the OS
271 * doesn't do it for us, call gettimeofday() on every UDP receive?
272 */
273#ifdef SO_TIMESTAMP
274#ifndef USE_CMSG
275#define USE_CMSG 1
276#endif
277#endif

279/*%
280 * The size to raise the receive buffer to (from BIND 8).
281 */
282#ifdef TUNE_LARGE
283#ifdef sun
284#define RCVBUFSIZE (1*1024*1024)
285#define SNDBUFSIZE (1*1024*1024)
286#else
287#define RCVBUFSIZE (16*1024*1024)
288#define SNDBUFSIZE (16*1024*1024)
289#endif
290#else
291#define RCVBUFSIZE (32*1024)
292#define SNDBUFSIZE (32*1024)
293#endif /* TUNE_LARGE */
294
295/*%
296 * Instead of calculating the cmsgbuf lengths every time we take
297 * a rule of thumb approach - sizes are taken from x86_64 linux,
298 * multiplied by 2, everything should fit. Those sizes are not
299 * large enough to cause any concern.
300 */
301#if defined(USE_CMSG)
302#define CMSG_SP_IN6PKT 40
303#else
304#define CMSG_SP_IN6PKT 0
305#endif
306
307#if defined(USE_CMSG) && defined(SO_TIMESTAMP)
308#define CMSG_SP_TIMESTAMP 32
309#else
310#define CMSG_SP_TIMESTAMP 0
311#endif
312
313#if defined(USE_CMSG) && (defined(IPV6_TCLASS) || defined(IP_TOS))
314#define CMSG_SP_TCTOS 24
315#else
316#define CMSG_SP_TCTOS 0
317#endif
318
319#define CMSG_SP_INT 24
320
321/* Align cmsg buffers to be safe on SPARC etc. */
322#define RECVCMSGBUFLEN ISC_ALIGN(2*(CMSG_SP_IN6PKT + CMSG_SP_TIMESTAMP + CMSG_SP_TCTOS)+1, sizeof(void*))
323#define SENDCMSGBUFLEN ISC_ALIGN(2*(CMSG_SP_IN6PKT + CMSG_SP_INT + CMSG_SP_TCTOS)+1, sizeof(void*))
324
325/*%
326 * The number of times a send operation is repeated if the result is EINTR.
327 */
328#define NRETRIES 10

336struct isc__socket {
337 /* Not locked. */
338 isc_socket_t common;
339 isc__socketmgr_t *manager;
340 isc_mutex_t lock;
341 isc_sockettype_t type;
342 const isc_statscounter_t *statsindex;
343 isc_refcount_t references;
344
345 /* Locked by socket lock. */
346 ISC_LINK(isc__socket_t) link;
347 int fd;
348 int pf;
349 int threadid;
350 char name[16];
351 void * tag;
352
353 ISC_LIST(isc_socketevent_t) send_list;
354 ISC_LIST(isc_socketevent_t) recv_list;
355 ISC_LIST(isc_socket_newconnev_t) accept_list;
356 ISC_LIST(isc_socket_connev_t) connect_list;
357
358 isc_sockaddr_t peer_address; /* remote address */
359
360 unsigned int listener : 1, /* listener socket */
361 connected : 1,
362 connecting : 1, /* connect pending */
363 bound : 1, /* bound to local addr */
364 dupped : 1,
365 active : 1, /* currently active */
366 pktdscp : 1; /* per packet dscp */
367
368#ifdef ISC_PLATFORM_RECVOVERFLOW
369 unsigned char overflow; /* used for MSG_TRUNC fake */
370#endif
371
372 void *fdwatcharg;
373 isc_sockfdwatch_t fdwatchcb;
374 int fdwatchflags;
375 isc_task_t *fdwatchtask;
376 unsigned int dscp;
377};

382struct isc__socketmgr {
383 /* Not locked. */

387 isc_stats_t *stats;
388 int nthreads;
389 isc__socketthread_t *threads;
390 unsigned int maxsocks;
391 /* Locked by manager lock. */
392 ISC_LIST(isc__socket_t) socklist;
393 int reserved; /* unlocked */
394 isc_condition_t shutdown_ok;
395 int maxudp;
396};

398struct isc__socketthread {
399 isc__socketmgr_t * manager;
400 int threadid;
401 isc_thread_t thread;
402 int pipe_fds[2];
403 isc_mutex_t *fdlock;
404 /* Locked by fdlock. */
405 isc__socket_t **fds;
406 int *fdstate;
407#ifdef USE_KQUEUE
408 int kqueue_fd;
409 int nevents;
410 struct kevent *events;
411#endif /* USE_KQUEUE */
412#ifdef USE_EPOLL
413 int epoll_fd;
414 int nevents;
415 struct epoll_event *events;
416 uint32_t *epoll_events;
417#endif /* USE_EPOLL */
418#ifdef USE_DEVPOLL
419 int devpoll_fd;
420 isc_resourcevalue_t open_max;
421 unsigned int calls;
422 int nevents;
423 struct pollfd *events;
424 pollinfo_t *fdpollinfo;
425#endif /* USE_DEVPOLL */
426#ifdef USE_SELECT
427 int fd_bufsize;
428 fd_set *read_fds;
429 fd_set *read_fds_copy;
430 fd_set *write_fds;
431 fd_set *write_fds_copy;
432 int maxfd;
433#endif /* USE_SELECT */
434};

579static int
580gen_threadid(isc__socket_t *sock);

582static int
583gen_threadid(isc__socket_t *sock) {
584 return sock->fd % sock->manager->nthreads;
585}
586
587static void
588manager_log(isc__socketmgr_t *sockmgr,
589 isc_logcategory_t *category, isc_logmodule_t *module, int level,
590 const char *fmt, ...) ISC_FORMAT_PRINTF(5, 6);
591static void
592manager_log(isc__socketmgr_t *sockmgr,
593 isc_logcategory_t *category, isc_logmodule_t *module, int level,
594 const char *fmt, ...)
595{
596 char msgbuf[2048];
597 va_list ap;
598
599 if (! isc_log_wouldlog(isc_lctx, level))
600 return;
601
602 va_start(ap, fmt);
603 vsnprintf(msgbuf, sizeof(msgbuf), fmt, ap);
604 va_end(ap);
605
606 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, category, module, level,
607 "sockmgr %p: %s", sockmgr, msgbuf);
608}
609
610static void
611thread_log(isc__socketthread_t *thread,
612 isc_logcategory_t *category, isc_logmodule_t *module, int level,
613 const char *fmt, ...) ISC_FORMAT_PRINTF(5, 6);
614static void
615thread_log(isc__socketthread_t *thread,
616 isc_logcategory_t *category, isc_logmodule_t *module, int level,
617 const char *fmt, ...)
618{
619 char msgbuf[2048];
620 va_list ap;
621
622 if (! isc_log_wouldlog(isc_lctx, level)) {
623 return;
624 }
625
626 va_start(ap, fmt);
627 vsnprintf(msgbuf, sizeof(msgbuf), fmt, ap);
628 va_end(ap);
629
630 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, category, module, level,
631 "sockmgr %p thread %d: %s",
632 thread->manager, thread->threadid, msgbuf);
633}
634
635static void
636socket_log(isc__socket_t *sock, const isc_sockaddr_t *address,
637 isc_logcategory_t *category, isc_logmodule_t *module, int level,
638 const char *fmt, ...) ISC_FORMAT_PRINTF(6, 7);
639static void
640socket_log(isc__socket_t *sock, const isc_sockaddr_t *address,
641 isc_logcategory_t *category, isc_logmodule_t *module, int level,
642 const char *fmt, ...)
643{
644 char msgbuf[2048];
645 char peerbuf[ISC_SOCKADDR_FORMATSIZE];
646 va_list ap;
647
648 if (! isc_log_wouldlog(isc_lctx, level))
649 return;
650
651 va_start(ap, fmt);
652 vsnprintf(msgbuf, sizeof(msgbuf), fmt, ap);
653 va_end(ap);
654
655 if (address == NULL) {
656 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, category, module, level,
657 "socket %p: %s", sock, msgbuf);
658 } else {
659 isc_sockaddr_format(address, peerbuf, sizeof(peerbuf));
660 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, category, module, level,
661 "socket %p %s: %s", sock, peerbuf, msgbuf);
662 }
663}
664
665/*%
666 * Increment socket-related statistics counters.
667 */
668static inline void
669inc_stats(isc_stats_t *stats, isc_statscounter_t counterid) {
670 REQUIRE(counterid != -1);
671
672 if (stats != NULL)
673 isc_stats_increment(stats, counterid);
674}
675
676/*%
677 * Decrement socket-related statistics counters.
678 */
679static inline void
680dec_stats(isc_stats_t *stats, isc_statscounter_t counterid) {
681 REQUIRE(counterid != -1);
682
683 if (stats != NULL)
684 isc_stats_decrement(stats, counterid);
685}
686
687static inline isc_result_t
688watch_fd(isc__socketthread_t *thread, int fd, int msg) {
689 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
690
691#ifdef USE_KQUEUE
692 struct kevent evchange;
693
694 memset(&evchange, 0, sizeof(evchange));
695 if (msg == SELECT_POKE_READ) {
696 evchange.filter = EVFILT_READ;
697 } else {
698 evchange.filter = EVFILT_WRITE;
699 }
700 evchange.flags = EV_ADD;
701 evchange.ident = fd;
702 if (kevent(thread->kqueue_fd, &evchange, 1, NULL, 0, NULL) != 0) {
703 result = isc__errno2result(errno);
704 }
705
706 return (result);
707#elif defined(USE_EPOLL)
708 struct epoll_event event;
709 uint32_t oldevents;
710 int ret;
711 int op;
712
713 oldevents = thread->epoll_events[fd];
714 if (msg == SELECT_POKE_READ) {
715 thread->epoll_events[fd] |= EPOLLIN;
716 } else {
717 thread->epoll_events[fd] |= EPOLLOUT;
718 }
719
720 event.events = thread->epoll_events[fd];
721 memset(&event.data, 0, sizeof(event.data));
722 event.data.fd = fd;
723
724 op = (oldevents == 0U) ? EPOLL_CTL_ADD : EPOLL_CTL_MOD;
725 ret = epoll_ctl(thread->epoll_fd, op, fd, &event);
726 if (ret == -1) {
727 if (errno == EEXIST) {
728 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
729 "epoll_ctl(ADD/MOD) returned "
730 "EEXIST for fd %d", fd);
731 }
732 result = isc__errno2result(errno);
733 }
734
735 return (result);
736#elif defined(USE_DEVPOLL)
737 struct pollfd pfd;
738 int lockid = FDLOCK_ID(fd);
739
740 memset(&pfd, 0, sizeof(pfd));
741 if (msg == SELECT_POKE_READ) {
742 pfd.events = POLLIN;
743 } else {
744 pfd.events = POLLOUT;
745 }
746 pfd.fd = fd;
747 pfd.revents = 0;
748 if (write(thread->devpoll_fd, &pfd, sizeof(pfd)) == -1) {
749 result = isc__errno2result(errno);
750 } else {
751 if (msg == SELECT_POKE_READ) {
752 thread->fdpollinfo[fd].want_read = 1;
753 } else {
754 thread->fdpollinfo[fd].want_write = 1;
755 }
756 }
757
758 return (result);
759#elif defined(USE_SELECT)
760 LOCK(&thread->manager->lock);
761 if (msg == SELECT_POKE_READ) {
762 FD_SET(fd, thread->read_fds);
763 }
764 if (msg == SELECT_POKE_WRITE) {
765 FD_SET(fd, thread->write_fds);
766 }
767 UNLOCK(&thread->manager->lock);
768
769 return (result);
770#endif
771}
772
773static inline isc_result_t
774unwatch_fd(isc__socketthread_t *thread, int fd, int msg) {
775 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
776
777#ifdef USE_KQUEUE
778 struct kevent evchange;
779
780 memset(&evchange, 0, sizeof(evchange));
781 if (msg == SELECT_POKE_READ) {
782 evchange.filter = EVFILT_READ;
783 } else {
784 evchange.filter = EVFILT_WRITE;
785 }
786 evchange.flags = EV_DELETE;
787 evchange.ident = fd;
788 if (kevent(thread->kqueue_fd, &evchange, 1, NULL, 0, NULL) != 0) {
789 result = isc__errno2result(errno);
790 }
791
792 return (result);
793#elif defined(USE_EPOLL)
794 struct epoll_event event;
795 int ret;
796 int op;
797
798 if (msg == SELECT_POKE_READ) {
799 thread->epoll_events[fd] &= ~(EPOLLIN);
800 } else {
801 thread->epoll_events[fd] &= ~(EPOLLOUT);
802 }
803
804 event.events = thread->epoll_events[fd];
805 memset(&event.data, 0, sizeof(event.data));
806 event.data.fd = fd;
807
808 op = (event.events == 0U) ? EPOLL_CTL_DEL : EPOLL_CTL_MOD;
809 ret = epoll_ctl(thread->epoll_fd, op, fd, &event);
810 if (ret == -1 && errno != ENOENT) {
811 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
812 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
813 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
814 "epoll_ctl(DEL), %d: %s", fd, strbuf);
815 result = ISC_R_UNEXPECTED;
816 }
817 return (result);
818#elif defined(USE_DEVPOLL)
819 struct pollfd pfds[2];
820 size_t writelen = sizeof(pfds[0]);
821 int lockid = FDLOCK_ID(fd);
822
823 memset(pfds, 0, sizeof(pfds));
824 pfds[0].events = POLLREMOVE;
825 pfds[0].fd = fd;
826
827 /*
828 * Canceling read or write polling via /dev/poll is tricky. Since it
829 * only provides a way of canceling per FD, we may need to re-poll the
830 * socket for the other operation.
831 */
832 if (msg == SELECT_POKE_READ &&
833 thread->fdpollinfo[fd].want_write == 1)
834 {
835 pfds[1].events = POLLOUT;
836 pfds[1].fd = fd;
837 writelen += sizeof(pfds[1]);
838 }
839 if (msg == SELECT_POKE_WRITE &&
840 thread->fdpollinfo[fd].want_read == 1)
841 {
842 pfds[1].events = POLLIN;
843 pfds[1].fd = fd;
844 writelen += sizeof(pfds[1]);
845 }
846
847 if (write(thread->devpoll_fd, pfds, writelen) == -1) {
848 result = isc__errno2result(errno);
849 } else {
850 if (msg == SELECT_POKE_READ) {
851 thread->fdpollinfo[fd].want_read = 0;
852 } else {
853 thread->fdpollinfo[fd].want_write = 0;
854 }
855 }
856
857 return (result);
858#elif defined(USE_SELECT)
859 LOCK(&thread->manager->lock);
860 if (msg == SELECT_POKE_READ) {
861 FD_CLR(fd, thread->read_fds);
862 } else if (msg == SELECT_POKE_WRITE) {
863 FD_CLR(fd, thread->write_fds);
864 }
865 UNLOCK(&thread->manager->lock);
866
867 return (result);
868#endif
869}
870
871/*
872 * A poke message was received, perform a proper watch/unwatch
873 * on a fd provided
874 */
875static void
876wakeup_socket(isc__socketthread_t *thread, int fd, int msg) {
877 isc_result_t result;
878 int lockid = FDLOCK_ID(fd);
879
880 /*
881 * This is a wakeup on a socket. If the socket is not in the
882 * process of being closed, start watching it for either reads
883 * or writes.
884 */
885
886 INSIST(fd >= 0 && fd < (int)thread->manager->maxsocks);
887
888 if (msg == SELECT_POKE_CLOSE) {
889 /* No one should be updating fdstate, so no need to lock it */
890 INSIST(thread->fdstate[fd] == CLOSE_PENDING);
891 thread->fdstate[fd] = CLOSED;
892 (void)unwatch_fd(thread, fd, SELECT_POKE_READ);
893 (void)unwatch_fd(thread, fd, SELECT_POKE_WRITE);
894 (void)close(fd);
895 return;
896 }
897
898 LOCK(&thread->fdlock[lockid]);
899 if (thread->fdstate[fd] == CLOSE_PENDING) {
900 UNLOCK(&thread->fdlock[lockid]);
901
902 /*
903 * We accept (and ignore) any error from unwatch_fd() as we are
904 * closing the socket, hoping it doesn't leave dangling state in
905 * the kernel.
906 * Note that unwatch_fd() must be called after releasing the
907 * fdlock; otherwise it could cause deadlock due to a lock order
908 * reversal.
909 */
910 (void)unwatch_fd(thread, fd, SELECT_POKE_READ);
911 (void)unwatch_fd(thread, fd, SELECT_POKE_WRITE);
912 return;
913 }
914 if (thread->fdstate[fd] != MANAGED) {
915 UNLOCK(&thread->fdlock[lockid]);
916 return;
917 }
918 UNLOCK(&thread->fdlock[lockid]);
919
920 /*
921 * Set requested bit.
922 */
923 result = watch_fd(thread, fd, msg);
924 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
925 /*
926 * XXXJT: what should we do? Ignoring the failure of watching
927 * a socket will make the application dysfunctional, but there
928 * seems to be no reasonable recovery process.
929 */
930 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
931 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
932 "failed to start watching FD (%d): %s",
933 fd, isc_result_totext(result));
934 }
935}
936
937/*
938 * Poke the select loop when there is something for us to do.
939 * The write is required (by POSIX) to complete. That is, we
940 * will not get partial writes.
941 */
942static void
943select_poke(isc__socketmgr_t *mgr, int threadid, int fd, int msg) {
944 int cc;
945 int buf[2];
946 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
947
948 buf[0] = fd;
949 buf[1] = msg;
950
951 do {
952 cc = write(mgr->threads[threadid].pipe_fds[1],
953 buf, sizeof(buf));
954#ifdef ENOSR
955 /*
956 * Treat ENOSR as EAGAIN but loop slowly as it is
957 * unlikely to clear fast.
958 */
959 if (cc < 0 && errno == ENOSR) {
960 sleep(1);
961 errno = EAGAIN;
962 }
963#endif
964 } while (cc < 0 && SOFT_ERROR(errno));
965
966 if (cc < 0) {
967 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
968 FATAL_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
969 "write() failed during watcher poke: %s",
970 strbuf);
971 }
972
973 INSIST(cc == sizeof(buf));
974}
975
976/*
977 * Read a message on the internal fd.
978 */
979static void
980select_readmsg(isc__socketthread_t *thread, int *fd, int *msg) {
981 int buf[2];
982 int cc;
983 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
984
985 cc = read(thread->pipe_fds[0], buf, sizeof(buf));
986 if (cc < 0) {
987 *msg = SELECT_POKE_NOTHING;
988 *fd = -1; /* Silence compiler. */
989 if (SOFT_ERROR(errno))
990 return;
991
992 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
993 FATAL_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
994 "read() failed during watcher poke: %s",
995 strbuf);
996 }
997 INSIST(cc == sizeof(buf));
998
999 *fd = buf[0];
1000 *msg = buf[1];
1001}
1002
1003/*
1004 * Make a fd non-blocking.
1005 */
1006static isc_result_t
1007make_nonblock(int fd) {
1008 int ret;
1009 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
1010#ifdef USE_FIONBIO_IOCTL
1011 int on = 1;
1012#else
1013 int flags;
1014#endif
1015
1016#ifdef USE_FIONBIO_IOCTL
1017 ret = ioctl(fd, FIONBIO, (char *)&on);
1018#else
1019 flags = fcntl(fd, F_GETFL, 0);
1020 flags |= PORT_NONBLOCK;
1021 ret = fcntl(fd, F_SETFL, flags);
1022#endif
1023
1024 if (ret == -1) {
1025 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
1026 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
1027#ifdef USE_FIONBIO_IOCTL
1028 "ioctl(%d, FIONBIO, &on): %s", fd,
1029#else
1030 "fcntl(%d, F_SETFL, %d): %s", fd, flags,
1031#endif
1032 strbuf);
1033
1034 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
1035 }
1036
1037 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1038}
1039
1040#ifdef USE_CMSG
1041/*
1042 * Not all OSes support advanced CMSG macros: CMSG_LEN and CMSG_SPACE.
1043 * In order to ensure as much portability as possible, we provide wrapper
1044 * functions of these macros.
1045 * Note that cmsg_space() could run slow on OSes that do not have
1046 * CMSG_SPACE.
1047 */
1048static inline socklen_t
1049cmsg_len(socklen_t len) {
1050#ifdef CMSG_LEN
1051 return (CMSG_LEN(len));
1052#else
1053 socklen_t hdrlen;
1054
1055 /*
1056 * Cast NULL so that any pointer arithmetic performed by CMSG_DATA
1057 * is correct.
1058 */
1059 hdrlen = (socklen_t)CMSG_DATA(((struct cmsghdr *)NULL));
1060 return (hdrlen + len);
1061#endif
1062}
1063
1064static inline socklen_t
1065cmsg_space(socklen_t len) {
1066#ifdef CMSG_SPACE
1067 return (CMSG_SPACE(len));
1068#else
1069 struct msghdr msg;
1070 struct cmsghdr *cmsgp;
1071 /*
1072 * XXX: The buffer length is an ad-hoc value, but should be enough
1073 * in a practical sense.
1074 */
1075 char dummybuf[sizeof(struct cmsghdr) + 1024];
1076
1077 memset(&msg, 0, sizeof(msg));
1078 msg.msg_control = dummybuf;
1079 msg.msg_controllen = sizeof(dummybuf);
1080
1081 cmsgp = (struct cmsghdr *)dummybuf;
1082 cmsgp->cmsg_len = cmsg_len(len);
1083
1084 cmsgp = CMSG_NXTHDR(&msg, cmsgp);
1085 if (cmsgp != NULL)
1086 return ((char *)cmsgp - (char *)msg.msg_control);
1087 else
1088 return (0);
1089#endif
1090}
1091#endif /* USE_CMSG */
1092
1093/*
1094 * Process control messages received on a socket.
1095 */
1096static void
1097process_cmsg(isc__socket_t *sock, struct msghdr *msg, isc_socketevent_t *dev) {
1098#ifdef USE_CMSG
1099 struct cmsghdr *cmsgp;
1100 struct in6_pktinfo *pktinfop;
1101#ifdef SO_TIMESTAMP
1102 void *timevalp;
1103#endif
1104#endif
1105
1106 /*
1107 * sock is used only when ISC_NET_BSD44MSGHDR and USE_CMSG are defined.
1108 * msg and dev are used only when ISC_NET_BSD44MSGHDR is defined.
1109 * They are all here, outside of the CPP tests, because it is
1110 * more consistent with the usual ISC coding style.
1111 */
1112 UNUSED(sock);
1113 UNUSED(msg);
1114 UNUSED(dev);
1115
1116#ifdef MSG_TRUNC
1117 if ((msg->msg_flags & MSG_TRUNC) != 0) {
1118 dev->attributes |= ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_TRUNC;
1119 }
1120#endif
1121
1122#ifdef MSG_CTRUNC
1123 if ((msg->msg_flags & MSG_CTRUNC) != 0) {
1124 dev->attributes |= ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_CTRUNC;
1125 }
1126#endif
1127
1128#ifndef USE_CMSG
1129 return;
1130#else
1131 if (msg->msg_controllen == 0U || msg->msg_control == NULL)
1132 return;
1133
1134#ifdef SO_TIMESTAMP
1135 timevalp = NULL;
1136#endif
1137 pktinfop = NULL;
1138
1139 cmsgp = CMSG_FIRSTHDR(msg);
1140 while (cmsgp != NULL) {
1141 socket_log(sock, NULL, TRACE,
1142 "processing cmsg %p", cmsgp);
1143
1144 if (cmsgp->cmsg_level == IPPROTO_IPV6
1145 && cmsgp->cmsg_type == IPV6_PKTINFO) {
1146
1147 pktinfop = (struct in6_pktinfo *)CMSG_DATA(cmsgp);
1148 memmove(&dev->pktinfo, pktinfop,
1149 sizeof(struct in6_pktinfo));
1150 dev->attributes |= ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_PKTINFO;
1151 socket_log(sock, NULL, TRACE,
1152 "interface received on ifindex %u",
1153 dev->pktinfo.ipi6_ifindex);
1154 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_MULTICAST(&pktinfop->ipi6_addr))
1155 dev->attributes |= ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_MULTICAST;
1156 goto next;
1157 }
1158
1159#ifdef SO_TIMESTAMP
1160 if (cmsgp->cmsg_level == SOL_SOCKET
1161 && cmsgp->cmsg_type == SCM_TIMESTAMP) {
1162 struct timeval tv;
1163 timevalp = CMSG_DATA(cmsgp);
1164 memmove(&tv, timevalp, sizeof(tv));
1165 dev->timestamp.seconds = tv.tv_sec;
1166 dev->timestamp.nanoseconds = tv.tv_usec * 1000;
1167 dev->attributes |= ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_TIMESTAMP;
1168 goto next;
1169 }
1170#endif
1171
1172#ifdef IPV6_TCLASS
1173 if (cmsgp->cmsg_level == IPPROTO_IPV6
1174 && cmsgp->cmsg_type == IPV6_TCLASS) {
1175 dev->dscp = *(int *)CMSG_DATA(cmsgp);
1176 dev->dscp >>= 2;
1177 dev->attributes |= ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_DSCP;
1178 goto next;
1179 }
1180#endif
1181
1182#ifdef IP_TOS
1183 if (cmsgp->cmsg_level == IPPROTO_IP
1184 && (cmsgp->cmsg_type == IP_TOS
1185#ifdef IP_RECVTOS
1186 || cmsgp->cmsg_type == IP_RECVTOS
1187#endif
1188 )) {
1189 dev->dscp = (int) *(unsigned char *)CMSG_DATA(cmsgp);
1190 dev->dscp >>= 2;
1191 dev->attributes |= ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_DSCP;
1192 goto next;
1193 }
1194#endif
1195 next:
1196 cmsgp = CMSG_NXTHDR(msg, cmsgp);
1197 }
1198#endif /* USE_CMSG */
1199}
1200
1201/*
1202 * Construct an iov array and attach it to the msghdr passed in. This is
1203 * the SEND constructor, which will use the used region of the buffer
1204 * (if using a buffer list) or will use the internal region (if a single
1205 * buffer I/O is requested).
1206 *
1207 * Nothing can be NULL, and the done event must list at least one buffer
1208 * on the buffer linked list for this function to be meaningful.
1209 *
1210 * If write_countp != NULL, *write_countp will hold the number of bytes
1211 * this transaction can send.
1212 */
1213static void
1214build_msghdr_send(isc__socket_t *sock, char* cmsgbuf, isc_socketevent_t *dev,
1215 struct msghdr *msg, struct iovec *iov, size_t *write_countp)
1216{
1217 unsigned int iovcount;
1218 size_t write_count;
1219 struct cmsghdr *cmsgp;
1220
1221 memset(msg, 0, sizeof(*msg));
1222
1223 if (!sock->connected) {
1224 msg->msg_name = (void *)&dev->address.type.sa;
1225 msg->msg_namelen = dev->address.length;
1226 } else {
1227 msg->msg_name = NULL;
1228 msg->msg_namelen = 0;
1229 }
1230
1231 write_count = dev->region.length - dev->n;
1232 iov[0].iov_base = (void *)(dev->region.base + dev->n);
1233 iov[0].iov_len = write_count;
1234 iovcount = 1;
1235
1236 msg->msg_iov = iov;
1237 msg->msg_iovlen = iovcount;
1238 msg->msg_control = NULL;
1239 msg->msg_controllen = 0;
1240 msg->msg_flags = 0;
1241#if defined(USE_CMSG)
1242
1243 if ((sock->type == isc_sockettype_udp) &&
1244 ((dev->attributes & ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_PKTINFO) != 0))
1245 {
1246 struct in6_pktinfo *pktinfop;
1247
1248 socket_log(sock, NULL, TRACE,
1249 "sendto pktinfo data, ifindex %u",
1250 dev->pktinfo.ipi6_ifindex);
1251
1252 msg->msg_control = (void *)cmsgbuf;
1253 msg->msg_controllen = cmsg_space(sizeof(struct in6_pktinfo));
1254 INSIST(msg->msg_controllen <= SENDCMSGBUFLEN);
1255
1256 cmsgp = (struct cmsghdr *)cmsgbuf;
1257 cmsgp->cmsg_level = IPPROTO_IPV6;
1258 cmsgp->cmsg_type = IPV6_PKTINFO;
1259 cmsgp->cmsg_len = cmsg_len(sizeof(struct in6_pktinfo));
1260 pktinfop = (struct in6_pktinfo *)CMSG_DATA(cmsgp);
1261 memmove(pktinfop, &dev->pktinfo, sizeof(struct in6_pktinfo));
1262 }
1263
1264#if defined(IPV6_USE_MIN_MTU)
1265 if ((sock->type == isc_sockettype_udp) && (sock->pf == AF_INET6) &&
1266 ((dev->attributes & ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_USEMINMTU) != 0))
1267 {
1268 int use_min_mtu = 1; /* -1, 0, 1 */
1269
1270 cmsgp = (struct cmsghdr *)(cmsgbuf +
1271 msg->msg_controllen);
1272 msg->msg_control = (void *)cmsgbuf;
1273 msg->msg_controllen += cmsg_space(sizeof(use_min_mtu));
1274 INSIST(msg->msg_controllen <= SENDCMSGBUFLEN);
1275
1276 cmsgp->cmsg_level = IPPROTO_IPV6;
1277 cmsgp->cmsg_type = IPV6_USE_MIN_MTU;
1278 cmsgp->cmsg_len = cmsg_len(sizeof(use_min_mtu));
1279 memmove(CMSG_DATA(cmsgp), &use_min_mtu, sizeof(use_min_mtu));
1280 }
1281#endif
1282
1283 if (isc_dscp_check_value > -1) {
1284 if (sock->type == isc_sockettype_udp)
1285 INSIST((int)dev->dscp == isc_dscp_check_value);
1286 else if (sock->type == isc_sockettype_tcp)
1287 INSIST((int)sock->dscp == isc_dscp_check_value);
1288 }
1289
1290#if defined(IP_TOS) || (defined(IPPROTO_IPV6) && defined(IPV6_TCLASS))
1291 if ((sock->type == isc_sockettype_udp) &&
1292 ((dev->attributes & ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_DSCP) != 0))
1293 {
1294 int dscp = (dev->dscp << 2) & 0xff;
1295
1296 INSIST(dev->dscp < 0x40);
1297
1298#ifdef IP_TOS
1299 if (sock->pf == AF_INET && sock->pktdscp) {
1300 cmsgp = (struct cmsghdr *)(cmsgbuf +
1301 msg->msg_controllen);
1302 msg->msg_control = (void *)cmsgbuf;
1303 msg->msg_controllen += cmsg_space(sizeof(dscp));
1304 INSIST(msg->msg_controllen <= SENDCMSGBUFLEN);
1305
1306 cmsgp->cmsg_level = IPPROTO_IP;
1307 cmsgp->cmsg_type = IP_TOS;
1308 cmsgp->cmsg_len = cmsg_len(sizeof(char));
1309 *(unsigned char*)CMSG_DATA(cmsgp) = dscp;
1310 } else if (sock->pf == AF_INET && sock->dscp != dev->dscp) {
1311 if (setsockopt(sock->fd, IPPROTO_IP, IP_TOS,
1312 (void *)&dscp, sizeof(int)) < 0)
1313 {
1314 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
1315 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
1316 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
1317 "setsockopt(%d, IP_TOS, %.02x)"
1318 " failed: %s",
1319 sock->fd, dscp >> 2,
1320 strbuf);
1321 } else
1322 sock->dscp = dscp;
1323 }
1324#endif
1325#if defined(IPPROTO_IPV6) && defined(IPV6_TCLASS)
1326 if (sock->pf == AF_INET6 && sock->pktdscp) {
1327 cmsgp = (struct cmsghdr *)(cmsgbuf +
1328 msg->msg_controllen);
1329 msg->msg_control = (void *)cmsgbuf;
1330 msg->msg_controllen += cmsg_space(sizeof(dscp));
1331 INSIST(msg->msg_controllen <= SENDCMSGBUFLEN);
1332
1333 cmsgp->cmsg_level = IPPROTO_IPV6;
1334 cmsgp->cmsg_type = IPV6_TCLASS;
1335 cmsgp->cmsg_len = cmsg_len(sizeof(dscp));
1336 memmove(CMSG_DATA(cmsgp), &dscp, sizeof(dscp));
1337 } else if (sock->pf == AF_INET6 && sock->dscp != dev->dscp) {
1338 if (setsockopt(sock->fd, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_TCLASS,
1339 (void *)&dscp, sizeof(int)) < 0) {
1340 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
1341 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
1342 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
1343 "setsockopt(%d, IPV6_TCLASS, "
1344 "%.02x) failed: %s",
1345 sock->fd, dscp >> 2,
1346 strbuf);
1347 } else
1348 sock->dscp = dscp;
1349 }
1350#endif
1351 if (msg->msg_controllen != 0 &&
1352 msg->msg_controllen < SENDCMSGBUFLEN)
1353 {
1354 memset(cmsgbuf + msg->msg_controllen, 0,
1355 SENDCMSGBUFLEN - msg->msg_controllen);
1356 }
1357 }
1358#endif
1359#endif /* USE_CMSG */
1360
1361 if (write_countp != NULL)
1362 *write_countp = write_count;
1363}
1364
1365/*
1366 * Construct an iov array and attach it to the msghdr passed in. This is
1367 * the RECV constructor, which will use the available region of the buffer
1368 * (if using a buffer list) or will use the internal region (if a single
1369 * buffer I/O is requested).
1370 *
1371 * Nothing can be NULL, and the done event must list at least one buffer
1372 * on the buffer linked list for this function to be meaningful.
1373 *
1374 * If read_countp != NULL, *read_countp will hold the number of bytes
1375 * this transaction can receive.
1376 */
1377static void
1378build_msghdr_recv(isc__socket_t *sock, char *cmsgbuf, isc_socketevent_t *dev,
1379 struct msghdr *msg, struct iovec *iov, size_t *read_countp)
1380{
1381 unsigned int iovcount;
1382 size_t read_count;
1383
1384 memset(msg, 0, sizeof(struct msghdr));
1385
1386 if (sock->type == isc_sockettype_udp) {
1387 memset(&dev->address, 0, sizeof(dev->address));
1388 msg->msg_name = (void *)&dev->address.type.sa;
1389 msg->msg_namelen = sizeof(dev->address.type);
1390 } else { /* TCP */
1391 msg->msg_name = NULL;
1392 msg->msg_namelen = 0;
1393 dev->address = sock->peer_address;
1394 }
1395
1396 read_count = dev->region.length - dev->n;
1397 iov[0].iov_base = (void *)(dev->region.base + dev->n);
1398 iov[0].iov_len = read_count;
1399 iovcount = 1;
1400
1401 /*
1402 * If needed, set up to receive that one extra byte.
1403 */
1404#ifdef ISC_PLATFORM_RECVOVERFLOW
1405 if (sock->type == isc_sockettype_udp) {
1406 INSIST(iovcount < MAXSCATTERGATHER_RECV);
1407 iov[iovcount].iov_base = (void *)(&sock->overflow);
1408 iov[iovcount].iov_len = 1;
1409 iovcount++;
1410 }
1411#endif
1412
1413 msg->msg_iov = iov;
1414 msg->msg_iovlen = iovcount;
1415
1416#if defined(USE_CMSG)
1417 msg->msg_control = cmsgbuf;
1418 msg->msg_controllen = RECVCMSGBUFLEN;
1419#else
1420 msg->msg_control = NULL;
1421 msg->msg_controllen = 0;
1422#endif /* USE_CMSG */
1423 msg->msg_flags = 0;
1424
1425 if (read_countp != NULL)
1426 *read_countp = read_count;
1427}
1428
1429static void
1430set_dev_address(const isc_sockaddr_t *address, isc__socket_t *sock,
1431 isc_socketevent_t *dev)
1432{
1433 if (sock->type == isc_sockettype_udp) {
1434 if (address != NULL)
1435 dev->address = *address;
1436 else
1437 dev->address = sock->peer_address;
1438 } else if (sock->type == isc_sockettype_tcp) {
1439 INSIST(address == NULL);
1440 dev->address = sock->peer_address;
1441 }
1442}
1443
1444static void
1445destroy_socketevent(isc_event_t *event) {
1446 isc_socketevent_t *ev = (isc_socketevent_t *)event;
1447
1448 (ev->destroy)(event);
1449}
1450
1451static isc_socketevent_t *
1452allocate_socketevent(isc_mem_t *mctx, void *sender,
1453 isc_eventtype_t eventtype, isc_taskaction_t action,
1454 void *arg)
1455{
1456 isc_socketevent_t *ev;
1457
1458 ev = (isc_socketevent_t *)isc_event_allocate(mctx, sender,
1459 eventtype, action, arg,
1460 sizeof(*ev));
1461
1462 if (ev == NULL)
1463 return (NULL);
1464
1465 ev->result = ISC_R_UNSET;
1466 ISC_LINK_INIT(ev, ev_link);
1467 ev->region.base = NULL;
1468 ev->n = 0;
1469 ev->offset = 0;
1470 ev->attributes = 0;
1471 ev->destroy = ev->ev_destroy;
1472 ev->ev_destroy = destroy_socketevent;
1473 ev->dscp = 0;
1474
1475 return (ev);
1476}
1477
1478#if defined(ISC_SOCKET_DEBUG)
1479static void
1480dump_msg(struct msghdr *msg) {
1481 unsigned int i;
1482
1483 printf("MSGHDR %p\n", msg);
1484 printf("\tname %p, namelen %ld\n", msg->msg_name,
1485 (long) msg->msg_namelen);
1486 printf("\tiov %p, iovlen %ld\n", msg->msg_iov,
1487 (long) msg->msg_iovlen);
1488 for (i = 0; i < (unsigned int)msg->msg_iovlen; i++)
1489 printf("\t\t%u\tbase %p, len %ld\n", i,
1490 msg->msg_iov[i].iov_base,
1491 (long) msg->msg_iov[i].iov_len);
1492 printf("\tcontrol %p, controllen %ld\n", msg->msg_control,
1493 (long) msg->msg_controllen);
1494}
1495#endif
1496
1497#define DOIO_SUCCESS 0 /* i/o ok, event sent */
1498#define DOIO_SOFT 1 /* i/o ok, soft error, no event sent */
1499#define DOIO_HARD 2 /* i/o error, event sent */
1500#define DOIO_EOF 3 /* EOF, no event sent */
1501
1502static int
1503doio_recv(isc__socket_t *sock, isc_socketevent_t *dev) {
1504 int cc;
1505 struct iovec iov[MAXSCATTERGATHER_RECV];
1506 size_t read_count;
1507 struct msghdr msghdr;
1508 int recv_errno;
1509 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
1510 char cmsgbuf[RECVCMSGBUFLEN] = {0};
1511
1512 build_msghdr_recv(sock, cmsgbuf, dev, &msghdr, iov, &read_count);
1513
1514#if defined(ISC_SOCKET_DEBUG)
1515 dump_msg(&msghdr);
1516#endif
1517
1518 cc = recvmsg(sock->fd, &msghdr, 0);
1519 recv_errno = errno;
1520
1521#if defined(ISC_SOCKET_DEBUG)
1522 dump_msg(&msghdr);
1523#endif
1524
1525 if (cc < 0) {
1526 if (SOFT_ERROR(recv_errno))
1527 return (DOIO_SOFT);
1528
1529 if (isc_log_wouldlog(isc_lctx, IOEVENT_LEVEL)) {
1530 strerror_r(recv_errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
1531 socket_log(sock, NULL, IOEVENT,
1532 "doio_recv: recvmsg(%d) %d bytes, err %d/%s",
1533 sock->fd, cc, recv_errno, strbuf);
1534 }
1535
1536#define SOFT_OR_HARD(_system, _isc) \
1537 if (recv_errno == _system) { \
1538 if (sock->connected) { \
1539 dev->result = _isc; \
1540 inc_stats(sock->manager->stats, \
1541 sock->statsindex[STATID_RECVFAIL]); \
1542 return (DOIO_HARD); \
1543 } \
1544 return (DOIO_SOFT); \
1545 }
1546#define ALWAYS_HARD(_system, _isc) \
1547 if (recv_errno == _system) { \
1548 dev->result = _isc; \
1549 inc_stats(sock->manager->stats, \
1550 sock->statsindex[STATID_RECVFAIL]); \
1551 return (DOIO_HARD); \
1552 }
1553
1554 SOFT_OR_HARD(ECONNREFUSED, ISC_R_CONNREFUSED);
1555 SOFT_OR_HARD(ENETUNREACH, ISC_R_NETUNREACH);
1556 SOFT_OR_HARD(EHOSTUNREACH, ISC_R_HOSTUNREACH);
1557 SOFT_OR_HARD(EHOSTDOWN, ISC_R_HOSTDOWN);
1558 SOFT_OR_HARD(ENOBUFS, ISC_R_NORESOURCES);
1559 /* Should never get this one but it was seen. */
1560#ifdef ENOPROTOOPT
1561 SOFT_OR_HARD(ENOPROTOOPT, ISC_R_HOSTUNREACH);
1562#endif
1563 SOFT_OR_HARD(EINVAL, ISC_R_HOSTUNREACH);
1564
1565#undef SOFT_OR_HARD
1566#undef ALWAYS_HARD
1567
1568 dev->result = isc__errno2result(recv_errno);
1569 inc_stats(sock->manager->stats,
1570 sock->statsindex[STATID_RECVFAIL]);
1571 return (DOIO_HARD);
1572 }
1573
1574 /*
1575 * On TCP and UNIX sockets, zero length reads indicate EOF,
1576 * while on UDP sockets, zero length reads are perfectly valid,
1577 * although strange.
1578 */
1579 switch (sock->type) {
1580 case isc_sockettype_tcp:
1581 case isc_sockettype_unix:
1582 if (cc == 0)
1583 return (DOIO_EOF);
1584 break;
1585 case isc_sockettype_udp:
1586 case isc_sockettype_raw:
1587 break;
1588 case isc_sockettype_fdwatch:
1589 default:
1590 INSIST(0);
1591 ISC_UNREACHABLE();
1592 }
1593
1594 if (sock->type == isc_sockettype_udp) {
1595 dev->address.length = msghdr.msg_namelen;
1596 if (isc_sockaddr_getport(&dev->address) == 0) {
1597 if (isc_log_wouldlog(isc_lctx, IOEVENT_LEVEL)) {
1598 socket_log(sock, &dev->address, IOEVENT,
1599 "dropping source port zero packet");
1600 }
1601 return (DOIO_SOFT);
1602 }
1603 /*
1604 * Simulate a firewall blocking UDP responses bigger than
1605 * 'maxudp' bytes.
1606 */
1607 if (sock->manager->maxudp != 0 && cc > sock->manager->maxudp)
1608 return (DOIO_SOFT);
1609 }
1610
1611 socket_log(sock, &dev->address, IOEVENT,
1612 "packet received correctly");
1613
1614 /*
1615 * Overflow bit detection. If we received MORE bytes than we should,
1616 * this indicates an overflow situation. Set the flag in the
1617 * dev entry and adjust how much we read by one.
1618 */
1619#ifdef ISC_PLATFORM_RECVOVERFLOW
1620 if ((sock->type == isc_sockettype_udp) && ((size_t)cc > read_count)) {
1621 dev->attributes |= ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_TRUNC;
1622 cc--;
1623 }
1624#endif
1625
1626 /*
1627 * If there are control messages attached, run through them and pull
1628 * out the interesting bits.
1629 */
1630 process_cmsg(sock, &msghdr, dev);
1631
1632 /*
1633 * update the buffers (if any) and the i/o count
1634 */
1635 dev->n += cc;
1636
1637 /*
1638 * If we read less than we expected, update counters,
1639 * and let the upper layer poke the descriptor.
1640 */
1641 if (((size_t)cc != read_count) && (dev->n < dev->minimum))
1642 return (DOIO_SOFT);
1643
1644 /*
1645 * Full reads are posted, or partials if partials are ok.
1646 */
1647 dev->result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
1648 return (DOIO_SUCCESS);
1649}
1650
1651/*
1652 * Returns:
1653 * DOIO_SUCCESS The operation succeeded. dev->result contains
1654 * ISC_R_SUCCESS.
1655 *
1656 * DOIO_HARD A hard or unexpected I/O error was encountered.
1657 * dev->result contains the appropriate error.
1658 *
1659 * DOIO_SOFT A soft I/O error was encountered. No senddone
1660 * event was sent. The operation should be retried.
1661 *
1662 * No other return values are possible.
1663 */
1664static int
1665doio_send(isc__socket_t *sock, isc_socketevent_t *dev) {
1666 int cc;
1667 struct iovec iov[MAXSCATTERGATHER_SEND];
1668 size_t write_count;
1669 struct msghdr msghdr;
1670 char addrbuf[ISC_SOCKADDR_FORMATSIZE];
1671 int attempts = 0;
1672 int send_errno;
1673 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
1674 char cmsgbuf[SENDCMSGBUFLEN] = {0};
1675
1676 build_msghdr_send(sock, cmsgbuf, dev, &msghdr, iov, &write_count);
1677
1678 resend:
1679 if (sock->type == isc_sockettype_udp &&
1680 sock->manager->maxudp != 0 &&
1681 write_count > (size_t)sock->manager->maxudp)
1682 cc = write_count;
1683 else
1684 cc = sendmsg(sock->fd, &msghdr, 0);
1685 send_errno = errno;
1686
1687 /*
1688 * Check for error or block condition.
1689 */
1690 if (cc < 0) {
1691 if (send_errno == EINTR && ++attempts < NRETRIES)
1692 goto resend;
1693
1694 if (SOFT_ERROR(send_errno)) {
1695 if (errno == EWOULDBLOCK || errno == EAGAIN)
1696 dev->result = ISC_R_WOULDBLOCK;
1697 return (DOIO_SOFT);
1698 }
1699
1700#define SOFT_OR_HARD(_system, _isc) \
1701 if (send_errno == _system) { \
1702 if (sock->connected) { \
1703 dev->result = _isc; \
1704 inc_stats(sock->manager->stats, \
1705 sock->statsindex[STATID_SENDFAIL]); \
1706 return (DOIO_HARD); \
1707 } \
1708 return (DOIO_SOFT); \
1709 }
1710#define ALWAYS_HARD(_system, _isc) \
1711 if (send_errno == _system) { \
1712 dev->result = _isc; \
1713 inc_stats(sock->manager->stats, \
1714 sock->statsindex[STATID_SENDFAIL]); \
1715 return (DOIO_HARD); \
1716 }
1717
1718 SOFT_OR_HARD(ECONNREFUSED, ISC_R_CONNREFUSED);
1719 ALWAYS_HARD(EACCES, ISC_R_NOPERM);
1720 ALWAYS_HARD(EAFNOSUPPORT, ISC_R_ADDRNOTAVAIL);
1721 ALWAYS_HARD(EADDRNOTAVAIL, ISC_R_ADDRNOTAVAIL);
1722 ALWAYS_HARD(EHOSTUNREACH, ISC_R_HOSTUNREACH);
1723#ifdef EHOSTDOWN
1724 ALWAYS_HARD(EHOSTDOWN, ISC_R_HOSTUNREACH);
1725#endif
1726 ALWAYS_HARD(ENETUNREACH, ISC_R_NETUNREACH);
1727 SOFT_OR_HARD(ENOBUFS, ISC_R_NORESOURCES);
1728 ALWAYS_HARD(EPERM, ISC_R_HOSTUNREACH);
1729 ALWAYS_HARD(EPIPE, ISC_R_NOTCONNECTED);
1730 ALWAYS_HARD(ECONNRESET, ISC_R_CONNECTIONRESET);
1731
1732#undef SOFT_OR_HARD
1733#undef ALWAYS_HARD
1734
1735 /*
1736 * The other error types depend on whether or not the
1737 * socket is UDP or TCP. If it is UDP, some errors
1738 * that we expect to be fatal under TCP are merely
1739 * annoying, and are really soft errors.
1740 *
1741 * However, these soft errors are still returned as
1742 * a status.
1743 */
1744 isc_sockaddr_format(&dev->address, addrbuf, sizeof(addrbuf));
1745 strerror_r(send_errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
1746 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__, "internal_send: %s: %s",
1747 addrbuf, strbuf);
1748 dev->result = isc__errno2result(send_errno);
1749 inc_stats(sock->manager->stats,
1750 sock->statsindex[STATID_SENDFAIL]);
1751 return (DOIO_HARD);
1752 }
1753
1754 if (cc == 0) {
1755 inc_stats(sock->manager->stats,
1756 sock->statsindex[STATID_SENDFAIL]);
1757 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
1758 "doio_send: send() returned 0");
1759 }
1760
1761 /*
1762 * If we write less than we expected, update counters, poke.
1763 */
1764 dev->n += cc;
1765 if ((size_t)cc != write_count)
1766 return (DOIO_SOFT);
1767
1768 /*
1769 * Exactly what we wanted to write. We're done with this
1770 * entry. Post its completion event.
1771 */
1772 dev->result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
1773 return (DOIO_SUCCESS);
1774}
1775
1776/*
1777 * Kill.
1778 *
1779 * Caller must ensure that the socket is not locked and no external
1780 * references exist.
1781 */
1782static void
1783socketclose(isc__socketthread_t *thread, isc__socket_t *sock, int fd) {
1784 int lockid = FDLOCK_ID(fd);
1785 /*
1786 * No one has this socket open, so the watcher doesn't have to be
1787 * poked, and the socket doesn't have to be locked.
1788 */
1789 LOCK(&thread->fdlock[lockid]);
1790 thread->fds[fd] = NULL;
1791 if (sock->type == isc_sockettype_fdwatch)
1792 thread->fdstate[fd] = CLOSED;
1793 else
1794 thread->fdstate[fd] = CLOSE_PENDING;
1795 UNLOCK(&thread->fdlock[lockid]);
1796 if (sock->type == isc_sockettype_fdwatch) {
1797 /*
1798 * The caller may close the socket once this function returns,
1799 * and `fd' may be reassigned for a new socket. So we do
1800 * unwatch_fd() here, rather than defer it via select_poke().
1801 * Note: this may complicate data protection among threads and
1802 * may reduce performance due to additional locks. One way to
1803 * solve this would be to dup() the watched descriptor, but we
1804 * take a simpler approach at this moment.
1805 */
1806 (void)unwatch_fd(thread, fd, SELECT_POKE_READ);
1807 (void)unwatch_fd(thread, fd, SELECT_POKE_WRITE);
1808 } else
1809 select_poke(thread->manager, thread->threadid, fd,
1810 SELECT_POKE_CLOSE);
1811
1812 inc_stats(thread->manager->stats, sock->statsindex[STATID_CLOSE]);
1813 if (sock->active == 1) {
1814 dec_stats(thread->manager->stats,
1815 sock->statsindex[STATID_ACTIVE]);
1816 sock->active = 0;
1817 }
1818
1819 /*
1820 * update manager->maxfd here (XXX: this should be implemented more
1821 * efficiently)
1822 */
1823#ifdef USE_SELECT
1824 LOCK(&thread->manager->lock);
1825 if (thread->maxfd == fd) {
1826 int i;
1827
1828 thread->maxfd = 0;
1829 for (i = fd - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
1830 lockid = FDLOCK_ID(i);
1831
1832 LOCK(&thread->fdlock[lockid]);
1833 if (thread->fdstate[i] == MANAGED) {
1834 thread->maxfd = i;
1835 UNLOCK(&thread->fdlock[lockid]);
1836 break;
1837 }
1838 UNLOCK(&thread->fdlock[lockid]);
1839 }
1840 if (thread->maxfd < thread->pipe_fds[0]) {
1841 thread->maxfd = thread->pipe_fds[0];
1842 }
1843 }
1844
1845 UNLOCK(&thread->manager->lock);
1846#endif /* USE_SELECT */
1847}
1848
1849static void
1850destroy(isc__socket_t **sockp) {
1851 int fd;
1852 isc__socket_t *sock = *sockp;
1853 isc__socketmgr_t *manager = sock->manager;
1854 isc__socketthread_t *thread;
1855
1856 socket_log(sock, NULL, CREATION, "destroying");
1857
1858 INSIST(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->connect_list));
1859 INSIST(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->accept_list));
1860 INSIST(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->recv_list));
1861 INSIST(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->send_list));
1862 INSIST(sock->fd >= -1 && sock->fd < (int)manager->maxsocks);
1863
1864 if (sock->fd >= 0) {
1865 fd = sock->fd;
1866 thread = &manager->threads[sock->threadid];
1867 sock->fd = -1;
1868 sock->threadid = -1;
1869 socketclose(thread, sock, fd);
1870 }
1871
1872 LOCK(&manager->lock);
1873
1874 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(manager->socklist, sock, link);
1875
1876 if (ISC_LIST_EMPTY(manager->socklist))
1877 SIGNAL(&manager->shutdown_ok);
1878
1879 /* can't unlock manager as its memory context is still used */
1880 free_socket(sockp);
1881
1882 UNLOCK(&manager->lock);
1883}
1884
1885static isc_result_t
1886allocate_socket(isc__socketmgr_t *manager, isc_sockettype_t type,
1887 isc__socket_t **socketp)
1888{
1889 isc__socket_t *sock;
1890
1891 sock = isc_mem_get(manager->mctx, sizeof(*sock));
1892
1893 sock->common.magic = 0;
1894 sock->common.impmagic = 0;
1895 isc_refcount_init(&sock->references, 0);
1896
1897 sock->manager = manager;
1898 sock->type = type;
1899 sock->fd = -1;
1900 sock->threadid = -1;
1901 sock->dscp = 0; /* TOS/TCLASS is zero until set. */
1902 sock->dupped = 0;
1903 sock->statsindex = NULL;
1904 sock->active = 0;
1905
1906 ISC_LINK_INIT(sock, link);
1907
1908 memset(sock->name, 0, sizeof(sock->name));
1909 sock->tag = NULL;
1910
1911 /*
1912 * Set up list of readers and writers to be initially empty.
1913 */
1914 ISC_LIST_INIT(sock->recv_list);
1915 ISC_LIST_INIT(sock->send_list);
1916 ISC_LIST_INIT(sock->accept_list);
1917 ISC_LIST_INIT(sock->connect_list);
1918 sock->listener = 0;
1919 sock->connected = 0;
1920 sock->connecting = 0;
1921 sock->bound = 0;
1922 sock->pktdscp = 0;
1923
1924 /*
1925 * Initialize the lock.
1926 */
1927 isc_mutex_init(&sock->lock);
1928
1929 sock->common.magic = ISCAPI_SOCKET_MAGIC;
1930 sock->common.impmagic = SOCKET_MAGIC;
1931 *socketp = sock;
1932
1933 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1934}
1935
1936/*
1937 * This event requires that the various lists be empty, that the reference
1938 * count be 1, and that the magic number is valid. The other socket bits,
1939 * like the lock, must be initialized as well. The fd associated must be
1940 * marked as closed, by setting it to -1 on close, or this routine will
1941 * also close the socket.
1942 */
1943static void
1944free_socket(isc__socket_t **socketp) {
1945 isc__socket_t *sock = *socketp;
1946
1947 INSIST(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
1948 INSIST(isc_refcount_current(&sock->references) == 0);
1949 INSIST(!sock->connecting);
1950 INSIST(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->recv_list));
1951 INSIST(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->send_list));
1952 INSIST(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->accept_list));
1953 INSIST(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->connect_list));
1954 INSIST(!ISC_LINK_LINKED(sock, link));
1955
1956 sock->common.magic = 0;
1957 sock->common.impmagic = 0;
1958
1959 isc_mutex_destroy(&sock->lock);
1960
1961 isc_mem_put(sock->manager->mctx, sock, sizeof(*sock));
1962
1963 *socketp = NULL;
1964}
1965
1966#ifdef SO_RCVBUF
1967static isc_once_t rcvbuf_once = ISC_ONCE_INIT;
1968static int rcvbuf = RCVBUFSIZE;
1969
1970static void
1971set_rcvbuf(void) {
1972 int fd;
1973 int max = rcvbuf, min;
1974 socklen_t len;
1975
1976 fd = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP);
1977 if (fd == -1) {
1978 switch (errno) {
1979 case EPROTONOSUPPORT:
1980 case EPFNOSUPPORT:
1981 case EAFNOSUPPORT:
1982 /*
1983 * Linux 2.2 (and maybe others) return EINVAL instead of
1984 * EAFNOSUPPORT.
1985 */
1986 case EINVAL:
1987 fd = socket(AF_INET6, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP);
1988 break;
1989 }
1990 }
1991 if (fd == -1)
1992 return;
1993
1994 len = sizeof(min);
1995 if (getsockopt(fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF, (void *)&min, &len) == 0 &&
1996 min < rcvbuf) {
1997 again:
1998 if (setsockopt(fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF, (void *)&rcvbuf,
1999 sizeof(rcvbuf)) == -1) {
2000 if (errno == ENOBUFS && rcvbuf > min) {
2001 max = rcvbuf - 1;
2002 rcvbuf = (rcvbuf + min) / 2;
2003 goto again;
2004 } else {
2005 rcvbuf = min;
2006 goto cleanup;
2007 }
2008 } else
2009 min = rcvbuf;
2010 if (min != max) {
2011 rcvbuf = max;
2012 goto again;
2013 }
2014 }
2015 cleanup:
2016 close (fd);
2017}
2018#endif
2019
2020#ifdef SO_SNDBUF
2021static isc_once_t sndbuf_once = ISC_ONCE_INIT;
2022static int sndbuf = SNDBUFSIZE;
2023
2024static void
2025set_sndbuf(void) {
2026 int fd;
2027 int max = sndbuf, min;
2028 socklen_t len;
2029
2030 fd = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP);
2031#if defined(ISC_PLATFORM_HAVEIPV6)
2032 if (fd == -1) {
2033 switch (errno) {
2034 case EPROTONOSUPPORT:
2035 case EPFNOSUPPORT:
2036 case EAFNOSUPPORT:
2037 /*
2038 * Linux 2.2 (and maybe others) return EINVAL instead of
2039 * EAFNOSUPPORT.
2040 */
2041 case EINVAL:
2042 fd = socket(AF_INET6, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP);
2043 break;
2044 }
2045 }
2046#endif
2047 if (fd == -1) {
2048 return;
2049 }
2050
2051 len = sizeof(min);
2052 if (getsockopt(fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDBUF, (void *)&min, &len) == 0 &&
2053 min < sndbuf)
2054 {
2055 again:
2056 if (setsockopt(fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDBUF, (void *)&sndbuf,
2057 sizeof(sndbuf)) == -1) {
2058 if (errno == ENOBUFS && sndbuf > min) {
2059 max = sndbuf - 1;
2060 sndbuf = (sndbuf + min) / 2;
2061 goto again;
2062 } else {
2063 sndbuf = min;
2064 goto cleanup;
2065 }
2066 } else {
2067 min = sndbuf;
2068 }
2069 if (min != max) {
2070 sndbuf = max;
2071 goto again;
2072 }
2073 }
2074 cleanup:
2075 close (fd);
2076}
2077#endif
2078
2079#ifdef SO_BSDCOMPAT
2080/*
2081 * This really should not be necessary to do. Having to workout
2082 * which kernel version we are on at run time so that we don't cause
2083 * the kernel to issue a warning about us using a deprecated socket option.
2084 * Such warnings should *never* be on by default in production kernels.
2085 *
2086 * We can't do this a build time because executables are moved between
2087 * machines and hence kernels.
2088 *
2089 * We can't just not set SO_BSDCOMAT because some kernels require it.
2090 */
2091
2092static isc_once_t bsdcompat_once = ISC_ONCE_INIT;
2093bool bsdcompat = true;
2094
2095static void
2096clear_bsdcompat(void) {
2097#ifdef __linux__
2098 struct utsname buf;
2099 char *endp;
2100 long int major;
2101 long int minor;
2102
2103 uname(&buf); /* Can only fail if buf is bad in Linux. */
2104
2105 /* Paranoia in parsing can be increased, but we trust uname(). */
2106 major = strtol(buf.release, &endp, 10);
2107 if (*endp == '.') {
2108 minor = strtol(endp+1, &endp, 10);
2109 if ((major > 2) || ((major == 2) && (minor >= 4))) {
2110 bsdcompat = false;
2111 }
2112 }
2113#endif /* __linux __ */
2114}
2115#endif
2116
2117static void
2118use_min_mtu(isc__socket_t *sock) {
2119#if !defined(IPV6_USE_MIN_MTU) && !defined(IPV6_MTU)
2120 UNUSED(sock);
2121#endif
2122#ifdef IPV6_USE_MIN_MTU
2123 /* use minimum MTU */
2124 if (sock->pf == AF_INET6) {
2125 int on = 1;
2126 (void)setsockopt(sock->fd, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_USE_MIN_MTU,
2127 (void *)&on, sizeof(on));
2128 }
2129#endif
2130#if defined(IPV6_MTU)
2131 /*
2132 * Use minimum MTU on IPv6 sockets.
2133 */
2134 if (sock->pf == AF_INET6) {
2135 int mtu = 1280;
2136 (void)setsockopt(sock->fd, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_MTU,
2137 &mtu, sizeof(mtu));
2138 }
2139#endif
2140}
2141
2142static void
2143set_tcp_maxseg(isc__socket_t *sock, int size) {
2144#ifdef TCP_MAXSEG
2145 if (sock->type == isc_sockettype_tcp)
2146 (void)setsockopt(sock->fd, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_MAXSEG,
2147 (void *)&size, sizeof(size));
2148#endif
2149}
2150
2151static isc_result_t
2152opensocket(isc__socketmgr_t *manager, isc__socket_t *sock,
2153 isc__socket_t *dup_socket)
2154{
2155 isc_result_t result;
2156 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
2157 const char *err = "socket";
2158 int tries = 0;
2159#if defined(USE_CMSG) || defined(SO_BSDCOMPAT) || defined(SO_NOSIGPIPE)
2160 int on = 1;
2161#endif
2162#if defined(SO_RCVBUF) || defined(SO_SNDBUF)
2163 socklen_t optlen;
2164 int size = 0;
2165#endif
2166
2167 again:
2168 if (dup_socket == NULL) {
2169 switch (sock->type) {
2170 case isc_sockettype_udp:
2171 sock->fd = socket(sock->pf, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP);
2172 break;
2173 case isc_sockettype_tcp:
2174 sock->fd = socket(sock->pf, SOCK_STREAM, IPPROTO_TCP);
2175 break;
2176 case isc_sockettype_unix:
2177 sock->fd = socket(sock->pf, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
2178 break;
2179 case isc_sockettype_raw:
2180 errno = EPFNOSUPPORT;
2181 /*
2182 * PF_ROUTE is a alias for PF_NETLINK on linux.
2183 */
2184#if defined(PF_ROUTE)
2185 if (sock->fd == -1 && sock->pf == PF_ROUTE) {
2186#ifdef NETLINK_ROUTE
2187 sock->fd = socket(sock->pf, SOCK_RAW,
2188 NETLINK_ROUTE);
2189#else
2190 sock->fd = socket(sock->pf, SOCK_RAW, 0);
2191#endif
2192 if (sock->fd != -1) {
2193#ifdef NETLINK_ROUTE
2194 struct sockaddr_nl sa;
2195 int n;
2196
2197 /*
2198 * Do an implicit bind.
2199 */
2200 memset(&sa, 0, sizeof(sa));
2201 sa.nl_family = AF_NETLINK;
2202 sa.nl_groups = RTMGRP_IPV4_IFADDR |
2203 RTMGRP_IPV6_IFADDR;
2204 n = bind(sock->fd,
2205 (struct sockaddr *) &sa,
2206 sizeof(sa));
2207 if (n < 0) {
2208 close(sock->fd);
2209 sock->fd = -1;
2210 }
2211#endif
2212 sock->bound = 1;
2213 }
2214 }
2215#endif
2216 break;
2217 case isc_sockettype_fdwatch:
2218 /*
2219 * We should not be called for isc_sockettype_fdwatch
2220 * sockets.
2221 */
2222 INSIST(0);
2223 break;
2224 }
2225 } else {
2226 sock->fd = dup(dup_socket->fd);
2227 sock->dupped = 1;
2228 sock->bound = dup_socket->bound;
2229 }
2230 if (sock->fd == -1 && errno == EINTR && tries++ < 42)
2231 goto again;
2232
2233#ifdef F_DUPFD
2234 /*
2235 * Leave a space for stdio and TCP to work in.
2236 */
2237 if (manager->reserved != 0 && sock->type == isc_sockettype_udp &&
2238 sock->fd >= 0 && sock->fd < manager->reserved) {
2239 int newfd, tmp;
2240 newfd = fcntl(sock->fd, F_DUPFD, manager->reserved);
2241 tmp = errno;
2242 (void)close(sock->fd);
2243 errno = tmp;
2244 sock->fd = newfd;
2245 err = "isc_socket_create: fcntl/reserved";
2246 } else if (sock->fd >= 0 && sock->fd < 20) {
2247 int newfd, tmp;
2248 newfd = fcntl(sock->fd, F_DUPFD, 20);
2249 tmp = errno;
2250 (void)close(sock->fd);
2251 errno = tmp;
2252 sock->fd = newfd;
2253 err = "isc_socket_create: fcntl";
2254 }
2255#endif
2256
2257 if (sock->fd >= (int)manager->maxsocks) {
2258 (void)close(sock->fd);
2259 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
2260 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
2261 "socket: file descriptor exceeds limit (%d/%u)",
2262 sock->fd, manager->maxsocks);
2263 inc_stats(manager->stats, sock->statsindex[STATID_OPENFAIL]);
2264 return (ISC_R_NORESOURCES);
2265 }
2266
2267 if (sock->fd < 0) {
2268 switch (errno) {
2269 case EMFILE:
2270 case ENFILE:
2271 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
2272 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
2273 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
2274 "%s: %s", err, strbuf);
2275 /* fallthrough */
2276 case ENOBUFS:
2277 inc_stats(manager->stats,
2278 sock->statsindex[STATID_OPENFAIL]);
2279 return (ISC_R_NORESOURCES);
2280
2281 case EPROTONOSUPPORT:
2282 case EPFNOSUPPORT:
2283 case EAFNOSUPPORT:
2284 /*
2285 * Linux 2.2 (and maybe others) return EINVAL instead of
2286 * EAFNOSUPPORT.
2287 */
2288 case EINVAL:
2289 inc_stats(manager->stats,
2290 sock->statsindex[STATID_OPENFAIL]);
2291 return (ISC_R_FAMILYNOSUPPORT);
2292
2293 default:
2294 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
2295 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
2296 "%s() failed: %s", err,
2297 strbuf);
2298 inc_stats(manager->stats,
2299 sock->statsindex[STATID_OPENFAIL]);
2300 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
2301 }
2302 }
2303
2304 if (dup_socket != NULL)
2305 goto setup_done;
2306
2307 result = make_nonblock(sock->fd);
2308 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2309 (void)close(sock->fd);
2310 inc_stats(manager->stats, sock->statsindex[STATID_OPENFAIL]);
2311 return (result);
2312 }
2313
2314#ifdef SO_BSDCOMPAT
2315 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_once_do(&bsdcompat_once,
2316 clear_bsdcompat) == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
2317 if (sock->type != isc_sockettype_unix && bsdcompat &&
2318 setsockopt(sock->fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_BSDCOMPAT,
2319 (void *)&on, sizeof(on)) < 0) {
2320 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
2321 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
2322 "setsockopt(%d, SO_BSDCOMPAT) failed: %s",
2323 sock->fd,
2324 strbuf);
2325 /* Press on... */
2326 }
2327#endif
2328
2329#ifdef SO_NOSIGPIPE
2330 if (setsockopt(sock->fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_NOSIGPIPE,
2331 (void *)&on, sizeof(on)) < 0) {
2332 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
2333 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
2334 "setsockopt(%d, SO_NOSIGPIPE) failed: %s",
2335 sock->fd,
2336 strbuf);
2337 /* Press on... */
2338 }
2339#endif
2340
2341 /*
2342 * Use minimum mtu if possible.
2343 */
2344 if (sock->type == isc_sockettype_tcp && sock->pf == AF_INET6) {
2345 use_min_mtu(sock);
2346 set_tcp_maxseg(sock, 1280 - 20 - 40); /* 1280 - TCP - IPV6 */
2347 }
2348
2349#if defined(USE_CMSG) || defined(SO_RCVBUF) || defined(SO_SNDBUF)
2350 if (sock->type == isc_sockettype_udp) {
2351
2352#if defined(USE_CMSG)
2353#if defined(SO_TIMESTAMP)
2354 if (setsockopt(sock->fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_TIMESTAMP,
2355 (void *)&on, sizeof(on)) < 0
2356 && errno != ENOPROTOOPT) {
2357 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
2358 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
2359 "setsockopt(%d, SO_TIMESTAMP) failed: %s",
2360 sock->fd,
2361 strbuf);
2362 /* Press on... */
2363 }
2364#endif /* SO_TIMESTAMP */
2365
2366#ifdef IPV6_RECVPKTINFO
2367 /* RFC 3542 */
2368 if ((sock->pf == AF_INET6)
2369 && (setsockopt(sock->fd, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_RECVPKTINFO,
2370 (void *)&on, sizeof(on)) < 0)) {
2371 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
2372 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
2373 "setsockopt(%d, IPV6_RECVPKTINFO) "
2374 "failed: %s", sock->fd,
2375 strbuf);
2376 }
2377#else
2378 /* RFC 2292 */
2379 if ((sock->pf == AF_INET6)
2380 && (setsockopt(sock->fd, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_PKTINFO,
2381 (void *)&on, sizeof(on)) < 0)) {
2382 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
2383 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
2384 "setsockopt(%d, IPV6_PKTINFO) failed: %s",
2385 sock->fd,
2386 strbuf);
2387 }
2388#endif /* IPV6_RECVPKTINFO */
2389#if defined(IPV6_MTU_DISCOVER) && defined(IPV6_PMTUDISC_DONT)
2390 /*
2391 * Turn off Path MTU discovery on IPv6/UDP sockets.
2392 */
2393 if (sock->pf == AF_INET6) {
2394 int action = IPV6_PMTUDISC_DONT;
2395 (void)setsockopt(sock->fd, IPPROTO_IPV6,
2396 IPV6_MTU_DISCOVER, &action,
2397 sizeof(action));
2398 }
2399#endif
2400#endif /* defined(USE_CMSG) */
2401
2402#if defined(IP_MTU_DISCOVER) && defined(IP_PMTUDISC_DONT)
2403 /*
2404 * Turn off Path MTU discovery on IPv4/UDP sockets.
2405 * Prefer IP_PMTUDISC_OMIT over IP_PMTUDISC_DONT
2406 * if it available.
2407 */
2408 if (sock->pf == AF_INET) {
2409 int action;
2410#if defined(IP_PMTUDISC_OMIT)
2411 action = IP_PMTUDISC_OMIT;
2412 if (setsockopt(sock->fd, IPPROTO_IP,
2413 IP_MTU_DISCOVER, &action,
2414 sizeof(action)) < 0) {
2415#endif
2416 action = IP_PMTUDISC_DONT;
2417 (void)setsockopt(sock->fd, IPPROTO_IP,
2418 IP_MTU_DISCOVER,
2419 &action, sizeof(action));
2420#if defined(IP_PMTUDISC_OMIT)
2421 }
2422#endif
2423 }
2424#endif
2425#if defined(IP_DONTFRAG)
2426 /*
2427 * Turn off Path MTU discovery on IPv4/UDP sockets.
2428 */
2429 if (sock->pf == AF_INET) {
2430 int off = 0;
2431 (void)setsockopt(sock->fd, IPPROTO_IP, IP_DONTFRAG,
2432 &off, sizeof(off));
2433 }
2434#endif
2435
2436#if defined(SO_RCVBUF)
2437 optlen = sizeof(size);
2438 if (getsockopt(sock->fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF,
2439 (void *)&size, &optlen) == 0 && size < rcvbuf) {
2440 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_once_do(&rcvbuf_once,
2441 set_rcvbuf) == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
2442 if (setsockopt(sock->fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF,
2443 (void *)&rcvbuf, sizeof(rcvbuf)) == -1) {
2444 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
2445 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
2446 "setsockopt(%d, SO_RCVBUF, %d) failed: %s",
2447 sock->fd, rcvbuf,
2448 strbuf);
2449 }
2450 }
2451#endif
2452
2453#if defined(SO_SNDBUF)
2454 optlen = sizeof(size);
2455 if (getsockopt(sock->fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDBUF,
2456 (void *)&size, &optlen) == 0 && size < sndbuf) {
2457 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_once_do(&sndbuf_once,
2458 set_sndbuf) == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
2459 if (setsockopt(sock->fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDBUF,
2460 (void *)&sndbuf, sizeof(sndbuf)) == -1) {
2461 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
2462 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
2463 "setsockopt(%d, SO_SNDBUF, %d) failed: %s",
2464 sock->fd, sndbuf,
2465 strbuf);
2466 }
2467 }
2468#endif
2469 }
2470#ifdef IPV6_RECVTCLASS
2471 if ((sock->pf == AF_INET6)
2472 && (setsockopt(sock->fd, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_RECVTCLASS,
2473 (void *)&on, sizeof(on)) < 0)) {
2474 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
2475 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
2476 "setsockopt(%d, IPV6_RECVTCLASS) "
2477 "failed: %s", sock->fd,
2478 strbuf);
2479 }
2480#endif
2481#ifdef IP_RECVTOS
2482 if ((sock->pf == AF_INET)
2483 && (setsockopt(sock->fd, IPPROTO_IP, IP_RECVTOS,
2484 (void *)&on, sizeof(on)) < 0)) {
2485 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
2486 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
2487 "setsockopt(%d, IP_RECVTOS) "
2488 "failed: %s", sock->fd,
2489 strbuf);
2490 }
2491#endif
2492#endif /* defined(USE_CMSG) || defined(SO_RCVBUF) || defined(SO_SNDBUF) */
2493
2494setup_done:
2495 inc_stats(manager->stats, sock->statsindex[STATID_OPEN]);
2496 if (sock->active == 0) {
2497 inc_stats(manager->stats, sock->statsindex[STATID_ACTIVE]);
2498 sock->active = 1;
2499 }
2500
2501 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
2502}
2503
2504/*
2505 * Create a 'type' socket or duplicate an existing socket, managed
2506 * by 'manager'. Events will be posted to 'task' and when dispatched
2507 * 'action' will be called with 'arg' as the arg value. The new
2508 * socket is returned in 'socketp'.
2509 */
2510static isc_result_t
2511socket_create(isc_socketmgr_t *manager0, int pf, isc_sockettype_t type,
2512 isc_socket_t **socketp, isc_socket_t *dup_socket)
2513{
2514 isc__socket_t *sock = NULL;
2515 isc__socketmgr_t *manager = (isc__socketmgr_t *)manager0;
2516 isc__socketthread_t *thread;
2517 isc_result_t result;
2518 int lockid;
2519
2520 REQUIRE(VALID_MANAGER(manager));
2521 REQUIRE(socketp != NULL && *socketp == NULL);
2522 REQUIRE(type != isc_sockettype_fdwatch);
2523
2524 result = allocate_socket(manager, type, &sock);
2525 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
2526 return (result);
2527
2528 switch (sock->type) {
2529 case isc_sockettype_udp:
2530 sock->statsindex =
2531 (pf == AF_INET) ? udp4statsindex : udp6statsindex;
2532#define DCSPPKT(pf) ((pf == AF_INET) ? ISC_NET_DSCPPKTV4 : ISC_NET_DSCPPKTV6)
2533 sock->pktdscp = (isc_net_probedscp() & DCSPPKT(pf)) != 0;
2534 break;
2535 case isc_sockettype_tcp:
2536 sock->statsindex =
2537 (pf == AF_INET) ? tcp4statsindex : tcp6statsindex;
2538 break;
2539 case isc_sockettype_unix:
2540 sock->statsindex = unixstatsindex;
2541 break;
2542 case isc_sockettype_raw:
2543 sock->statsindex = rawstatsindex;
2544 break;
2545 default:
2546 INSIST(0);
2547 ISC_UNREACHABLE();
2548 }
2549
2550 sock->pf = pf;
2551
2552 result = opensocket(manager, sock, (isc__socket_t *)dup_socket);
2553 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2554 free_socket(&sock);
2555 return (result);
2556 }
2557
2558 if (sock->fd == -1) {
2559 abort();
2560 }
2561 sock->threadid = gen_threadid(sock);
2562 isc_refcount_init(&sock->references, 1);
2563 thread = &manager->threads[sock->threadid];
2564 *socketp = (isc_socket_t *)sock;
2565
2566 /*
2567 * Note we don't have to lock the socket like we normally would because
2568 * there are no external references to it yet.
2569 */
2570
2571 lockid = FDLOCK_ID(sock->fd);
2572 LOCK(&thread->fdlock[lockid]);
2573 thread->fds[sock->fd] = sock;
2574 thread->fdstate[sock->fd] = MANAGED;
2575#if defined(USE_EPOLL)
2576 thread->epoll_events[sock->fd] = 0;
2577#endif
2578#ifdef USE_DEVPOLL
2579 INSIST(thread->fdpollinfo[sock->fd].want_read == 0 &&
2580 thread->fdpollinfo[sock->fd].want_write == 0);
2581#endif
2582 UNLOCK(&thread->fdlock[lockid]);
2583
2584 LOCK(&manager->lock);
2585 ISC_LIST_APPEND(manager->socklist, sock, link);
2586#ifdef USE_SELECT
2587 if (thread->maxfd < sock->fd) {
2588 thread->maxfd = sock->fd;
2589 }
2590#endif
2591 UNLOCK(&manager->lock);
2592
2593 socket_log(sock, NULL, CREATION,
2594 dup_socket != NULL ? "dupped" : "created");
2595
2596 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
2597}
2598
2599/*%
2600 * Create a new 'type' socket managed by 'manager'. Events
2601 * will be posted to 'task' and when dispatched 'action' will be
2602 * called with 'arg' as the arg value. The new socket is returned
2603 * in 'socketp'.
2604 */
2605isc_result_t
2606isc_socket_create(isc_socketmgr_t *manager0, int pf, isc_sockettype_t type,
2607 isc_socket_t **socketp)
2608{
2609 return (socket_create(manager0, pf, type, socketp, NULL));
2610}
2611
2612/*%
2613 * Duplicate an existing socket. The new socket is returned
2614 * in 'socketp'.
2615 */
2616isc_result_t
2617isc_socket_dup(isc_socket_t *sock0, isc_socket_t **socketp) {
2618 isc__socket_t *sock = (isc__socket_t *)sock0;
2619
2620 REQUIRE(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
2621 REQUIRE(socketp != NULL && *socketp == NULL);
2622
2623 return (socket_create((isc_socketmgr_t *) sock->manager,
2624 sock->pf, sock->type, socketp,
2625 sock0));
2626}
2627
2628isc_result_t
2629isc_socket_open(isc_socket_t *sock0) {
2630 isc_result_t result;
2631 isc__socket_t *sock = (isc__socket_t *)sock0;
2632 isc__socketthread_t *thread;
2633
2634 REQUIRE(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
2635
2636 REQUIRE(isc_refcount_current(&sock->references) == 1);
2637 /*
2638 * We don't need to retain the lock hereafter, since no one else has
2639 * this socket.
2640 */
2641 REQUIRE(sock->fd == -1);
2642 REQUIRE(sock->threadid == -1);
2643 REQUIRE(sock->type != isc_sockettype_fdwatch);
2644
2645 result = opensocket(sock->manager, sock, NULL);
2646 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
2647 sock->fd = -1;
2648 } else {
2649 sock->threadid = gen_threadid(sock);
2650 thread = &sock->manager->threads[sock->threadid];
2651 int lockid = FDLOCK_ID(sock->fd);
2652
2653 LOCK(&thread->fdlock[lockid]);
2654 thread->fds[sock->fd] = sock;
2655 thread->fdstate[sock->fd] = MANAGED;
2656#if defined(USE_EPOLL)
2657 thread->epoll_events[sock->fd] = 0;
2658#endif
2659#ifdef USE_DEVPOLL
2660 INSIST(thread->fdpollinfo[sock->fd].want_read == 0 &&
2661 thread->fdpollinfo[sock->fd].want_write == 0);
2662#endif
2663 UNLOCK(&thread->fdlock[lockid]);
2664
2665#ifdef USE_SELECT
2666 LOCK(&sock->manager->lock);
2667 if (thread->maxfd < sock->fd)
2668 thread->maxfd = sock->fd;
2669 UNLOCK(&sock->manager->lock);
2670#endif
2671 }
2672
2673 return (result);
2674}
2675
2676
2677/*
2678 * Attach to a socket. Caller must explicitly detach when it is done.
2679 */
2680void
2681isc_socket_attach(isc_socket_t *sock0, isc_socket_t **socketp) {
2682 isc__socket_t *sock = (isc__socket_t *)sock0;
2683
2684 REQUIRE(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
2685 REQUIRE(socketp != NULL && *socketp == NULL);
2686
2687 int old_refs = isc_refcount_increment(&sock->references);
2688 REQUIRE(old_refs > 0);
2689
2690 *socketp = (isc_socket_t *)sock;
2691}
2692
2693/*
2694 * Dereference a socket. If this is the last reference to it, clean things
2695 * up by destroying the socket.
2696 */
2697void
2698isc_socket_detach(isc_socket_t **socketp) {
2699 isc__socket_t *sock;
2700
2701 REQUIRE(socketp != NULL);
2702 sock = (isc__socket_t *)*socketp;
2703 REQUIRE(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
2704
2705 if (isc_refcount_decrement(&sock->references) == 1) {
2706 destroy(&sock);
2707 }
2708
2709 *socketp = NULL;
2710}
2711
2712isc_result_t
2713isc_socket_close(isc_socket_t *sock0) {
2714 isc__socket_t *sock = (isc__socket_t *)sock0;
2715 int fd;
2716 isc__socketmgr_t *manager;
2717 isc__socketthread_t *thread;
2718 fflush(stdout);
2719 REQUIRE(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
2720
2721 LOCK(&sock->lock);
2722
2723 REQUIRE(sock->type != isc_sockettype_fdwatch);
2724 REQUIRE(sock->fd >= 0 && sock->fd < (int)sock->manager->maxsocks);
2725
2726 INSIST(!sock->connecting);
2727 INSIST(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->recv_list));
2728 INSIST(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->send_list));
2729 INSIST(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->accept_list));
2730 INSIST(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->connect_list));
2731
2732 manager = sock->manager;
2733 thread = &manager->threads[sock->threadid];
2734 fd = sock->fd;
2735 sock->fd = -1;
2736 sock->threadid = -1;
2737
2738 sock->dupped = 0;
2739 memset(sock->name, 0, sizeof(sock->name));
2740 sock->tag = NULL;
2741 sock->listener = 0;
2742 sock->connected = 0;
2743 sock->connecting = 0;
2744 sock->bound = 0;
2745 isc_sockaddr_any(&sock->peer_address);
2746
2747 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
2748
2749 socketclose(thread, sock, fd);
2750
2751 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
2752}
2753
2754static void
2755dispatch_recv(isc__socket_t *sock) {
2756 if (sock->type != isc_sockettype_fdwatch) {
2757 internal_recv(sock);
2758 } else {
2759 internal_fdwatch_read(sock);
2760 }
2761}
2762
2763static void
2764dispatch_send(isc__socket_t *sock) {
2765 if (sock->type != isc_sockettype_fdwatch) {
2766 internal_send(sock);
2767 } else {
2768 internal_fdwatch_write(sock);
2769 }
2770}
2771
2772/*
2773 * Dequeue an item off the given socket's read queue, set the result code
2774 * in the done event to the one provided, and send it to the task it was
2775 * destined for.
2776 *
2777 * If the event to be sent is on a list, remove it before sending. If
2778 * asked to, send and detach from the socket as well.
2779 *
2780 * Caller must have the socket locked if the event is attached to the socket.
2781 */
2782static void
2783send_recvdone_event(isc__socket_t *sock, isc_socketevent_t **dev) {
2784 isc_task_t *task;
2785
2786 task = (*dev)->ev_sender;
2787
2788 (*dev)->ev_sender = sock;
2789
2790 if (ISC_LINK_LINKED(*dev, ev_link)) {
2791 ISC_LIST_DEQUEUE(sock->recv_list, *dev, ev_link);
2792 }
2793
2794 if (((*dev)->attributes & ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_ATTACHED) != 0) {
2795 isc_task_sendtoanddetach(&task, (isc_event_t **)dev,
2796 sock->threadid);
2797 } else {
2798 isc_task_sendto(task, (isc_event_t **)dev, sock->threadid);
2799 }
2800}
2801
2802/*
2803 * See comments for send_recvdone_event() above.
2804 *
2805 * Caller must have the socket locked if the event is attached to the socket.
2806 */
2807static void
2808send_senddone_event(isc__socket_t *sock, isc_socketevent_t **dev) {
2809 isc_task_t *task;
2810
2811 INSIST(dev != NULL && *dev != NULL);
2812
2813 task = (*dev)->ev_sender;
2814 (*dev)->ev_sender = sock;
2815
2816 if (ISC_LINK_LINKED(*dev, ev_link))
2817 ISC_LIST_DEQUEUE(sock->send_list, *dev, ev_link);
2818
2819 if (((*dev)->attributes & ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_ATTACHED) != 0) {
2820 isc_task_sendtoanddetach(&task, (isc_event_t **)dev,
2821 sock->threadid);
2822 } else {
2823 isc_task_sendto(task, (isc_event_t **)dev, sock->threadid);
2824 }
2825}
2826
2827/*
2828 * See comments for send_recvdone_event() above.
2829 *
2830 * Caller must have the socket locked if the event is attached to the socket.
2831 */
2832static void
2833send_connectdone_event(isc__socket_t *sock, isc_socket_connev_t **dev) {
2834 isc_task_t *task;
2835
2836 INSIST(dev != NULL && *dev != NULL);
2837
2838 task = (*dev)->ev_sender;
2839 (*dev)->ev_sender = sock;
2840
2841 if (ISC_LINK_LINKED(*dev, ev_link)) {
2842 ISC_LIST_DEQUEUE(sock->connect_list, *dev, ev_link);
2843 }
2844
2845 isc_task_sendtoanddetach(&task, (isc_event_t **)dev, sock->threadid);
2846}
2847
2848/*
2849 * Call accept() on a socket, to get the new file descriptor. The listen
2850 * socket is used as a prototype to create a new isc_socket_t. The new
2851 * socket has one outstanding reference. The task receiving the event
2852 * will be detached from just after the event is delivered.
2853 *
2854 * On entry to this function, the event delivered is the internal
2855 * readable event, and the first item on the accept_list should be
2856 * the done event we want to send. If the list is empty, this is a no-op,
2857 * so just unlock and return.
2858 */
2859static void
2860internal_accept(isc__socket_t *sock) {
2861 isc__socketmgr_t *manager;
2862 isc__socketthread_t *thread, *nthread;
2863 isc_socket_newconnev_t *dev;
2864 isc_task_t *task;
2865 socklen_t addrlen;
2866 int fd;
2867 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
2868 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
2869 const char *err = "accept";
2870
2871 INSIST(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
2872
2873 LOCK(&sock->lock);
2874 if (sock->fd < 0) {
2875 /* Socket is gone */
2876 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
2877 return;
2878 }
2879 socket_log(sock, NULL, TRACE,
2880 "internal_accept called, locked socket");
2881
2882 manager = sock->manager;
2883 INSIST(VALID_MANAGER(manager));
2884 thread = &manager->threads[sock->threadid];
2885
2886 INSIST(sock->listener);
2887
2888 /*
2889 * Get the first item off the accept list.
2890 * If it is empty, unlock the socket and return.
2891 */
2892 dev = ISC_LIST_HEAD(sock->accept_list);
2893 if (dev == NULL) {
2894 unwatch_fd(thread, sock->fd, SELECT_POKE_ACCEPT);
2895 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
2896 return;
2897 }
2898
2899 /*
2900 * Try to accept the new connection. If the accept fails with
2901 * EAGAIN or EINTR, simply poke the watcher to watch this socket
2902 * again. Also ignore ECONNRESET, which has been reported to
2903 * be spuriously returned on Linux 2.2.19 although it is not
2904 * a documented error for accept(). ECONNABORTED has been
2905 * reported for Solaris 8. The rest are thrown in not because
2906 * we have seen them but because they are ignored by other
2907 * daemons such as BIND 8 and Apache.
2908 */
2909
2910 addrlen = sizeof(NEWCONNSOCK(dev)->peer_address.type);
2911 memset(&NEWCONNSOCK(dev)->peer_address.type, 0, addrlen);
2912 fd = accept(sock->fd, &NEWCONNSOCK(dev)->peer_address.type.sa,
2913 (void *)&addrlen);
2914
2915#ifdef F_DUPFD
2916 /*
2917 * Leave a space for stdio to work in.
2918 */
2919 if (fd >= 0 && fd < 20) {
2920 int newfd, tmp;
2921 newfd = fcntl(fd, F_DUPFD, 20);
2922 tmp = errno;
2923 (void)close(fd);
2924 errno = tmp;
2925 fd = newfd;
2926 err = "accept/fcntl";
2927 }
2928#endif
2929
2930 if (fd < 0) {
2931 if (SOFT_ERROR(errno))
2932 goto soft_error;
2933 switch (errno) {
2934 case ENFILE:
2935 case EMFILE:
2936 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
2937 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
2938 "%s: too many open file descriptors",
2939 err);
2940 goto soft_error;
2941
2942 case ENOBUFS:
2943 case ENOMEM:
2944 case ECONNRESET:
2945 case ECONNABORTED:
2946 case EHOSTUNREACH:
2947 case EHOSTDOWN:
2948 case ENETUNREACH:
2949 case ENETDOWN:
2950 case ECONNREFUSED:
2951#ifdef EPROTO
2952 case EPROTO:
2953#endif
2954#ifdef ENONET
2955 case ENONET:
2956#endif
2957 goto soft_error;
2958 default:
2959 break;
2960 }
2961 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
2962 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
2963 "internal_accept: %s() failed: %s", err,
2964 strbuf);
2965 fd = -1;
2966 result = ISC_R_UNEXPECTED;
2967 } else {
2968 if (addrlen == 0U) {
2969 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
2970 "internal_accept(): "
2971 "accept() failed to return "
2972 "remote address");
2973
2974 (void)close(fd);
2975 goto soft_error;
2976 } else if (NEWCONNSOCK(dev)->peer_address.type.sa.sa_family !=
2977 sock->pf)
2978 {
2979 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
2980 "internal_accept(): "
2981 "accept() returned peer address "
2982 "family %u (expected %u)",
2983 NEWCONNSOCK(dev)->peer_address.
2984 type.sa.sa_family,
2985 sock->pf);
2986 (void)close(fd);
2987 goto soft_error;
2988 } else if (fd >= (int)manager->maxsocks) {
2989 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
2990 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
2991 "accept: file descriptor exceeds limit (%d/%u)",
2992 fd, manager->maxsocks);
2993 (void)close(fd);
2994 goto soft_error;
2995 }
2996 }
2997
2998 if (fd != -1) {
2999 NEWCONNSOCK(dev)->peer_address.length = addrlen;
3000 NEWCONNSOCK(dev)->pf = sock->pf;
3001 }
3002
3003 /*
3004 * Pull off the done event.
3005 */
3006 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(sock->accept_list, dev, ev_link);
3007
3008 /*
3009 * Poke watcher if there are more pending accepts.
3010 */
3011 if (ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->accept_list))
3012 unwatch_fd(thread, sock->fd,
3013 SELECT_POKE_ACCEPT);
3014
3015 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
3016
3017 if (fd != -1) {
3018 result = make_nonblock(fd);
3019 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
3020 (void)close(fd);
3021 fd = -1;
3022 }
3023 }
3024
3025 /*
3026 * -1 means the new socket didn't happen.
3027 */
3028 if (fd != -1) {
3029 int lockid = FDLOCK_ID(fd);
3030
3031 NEWCONNSOCK(dev)->fd = fd;
3032 NEWCONNSOCK(dev)->threadid = gen_threadid(NEWCONNSOCK(dev));
3033 NEWCONNSOCK(dev)->bound = 1;
3034 NEWCONNSOCK(dev)->connected = 1;
3035 nthread = &manager->threads[NEWCONNSOCK(dev)->threadid];
3036
3037 /*
3038 * Use minimum mtu if possible.
3039 */
3040 use_min_mtu(NEWCONNSOCK(dev));
3041 set_tcp_maxseg(NEWCONNSOCK(dev), 1280 - 20 - 40);
3042
3043 /*
3044 * Ensure DSCP settings are inherited across accept.
3045 */
3046 setdscp(NEWCONNSOCK(dev), sock->dscp);
3047
3048 /*
3049 * Save away the remote address
3050 */
3051 dev->address = NEWCONNSOCK(dev)->peer_address;
3052
3053 if (NEWCONNSOCK(dev)->active == 0) {
3054 inc_stats(manager->stats,
3055 NEWCONNSOCK(dev)->statsindex[STATID_ACTIVE]);
3056 NEWCONNSOCK(dev)->active = 1;
3057 }
3058
3059 LOCK(&nthread->fdlock[lockid]);
3060 nthread->fds[fd] = NEWCONNSOCK(dev);
3061 nthread->fdstate[fd] = MANAGED;
3062#if defined(USE_EPOLL)
3063 nthread->epoll_events[fd] = 0;
3064#endif
