3065 UNLOCK(&nthread->fdlock[lockid]);
3066
3067 LOCK(&manager->lock);
3068
3069#ifdef USE_SELECT
3070 if (nthread->maxfd < fd)
3071 nthread->maxfd = fd;
3072#endif
3073
3074 socket_log(sock, &NEWCONNSOCK(dev)->peer_address, CREATION,
3075 "accepted connection, new socket %p",
3076 dev->newsocket);
3077
3078 ISC_LIST_APPEND(manager->socklist, NEWCONNSOCK(dev), link);
3079
3080 UNLOCK(&manager->lock);
3081
3082 inc_stats(manager->stats, sock->statsindex[STATID_ACCEPT]);
3083 } else {
3084 inc_stats(manager->stats, sock->statsindex[STATID_ACCEPTFAIL]);
3085 NEWCONNSOCK(dev)->references--;
3086 free_socket((isc__socket_t **)&dev->newsocket);
3087 }
3088
3089 /*
3090 * Fill in the done event details and send it off.
3091 */
3092 dev->result = result;
3093 task = dev->ev_sender;
3094 dev->ev_sender = sock;
3095
3096 isc_task_sendtoanddetach(&task, ISC_EVENT_PTR(&dev), sock->threadid);
3097 return;
3098
3099 soft_error:
3100 watch_fd(thread, sock->fd, SELECT_POKE_ACCEPT);
3101 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
3102
3103 inc_stats(manager->stats, sock->statsindex[STATID_ACCEPTFAIL]);
3104 return;
3105}
3106
3107static void
3108internal_recv(isc__socket_t *sock) {
3109 isc_socketevent_t *dev;
3110
3111 INSIST(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
3112
3113 LOCK(&sock->lock);
3114 if (sock->fd < 0) {
3115 /* Socket is gone */
3116 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
3117 return;
3118 }
3119 dev = ISC_LIST_HEAD(sock->recv_list);
3120 if (dev == NULL) {
3121 goto finish;
3122 }
3123
3124 socket_log(sock, NULL, IOEVENT,
3125 "internal_recv: event %p -> task %p", dev, dev->ev_sender);
3126
3127 /*
3128 * Try to do as much I/O as possible on this socket. There are no
3129 * limits here, currently.
3130 */
3131 while (dev != NULL) {
3132 switch (doio_recv(sock, dev)) {
3133 case DOIO_SOFT:
3134 goto finish;
3135
3136 case DOIO_EOF:
3137 /*
3138 * read of 0 means the remote end was closed.
3139 * Run through the event queue and dispatch all
3140 * the events with an EOF result code.
3141 */
3142 do {
3143 dev->result = ISC_R_EOF;
3144 send_recvdone_event(sock, &dev);
3145 dev = ISC_LIST_HEAD(sock->recv_list);
3146 } while (dev != NULL);
3147 goto finish;
3148
3149 case DOIO_SUCCESS:
3150 case DOIO_HARD:
3151 send_recvdone_event(sock, &dev);
3152 break;
3153 }
3154
3155 dev = ISC_LIST_HEAD(sock->recv_list);
3156 }
3157
3158 finish:
3159 if (ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->recv_list)) {
3160 unwatch_fd(&sock->manager->threads[sock->threadid], sock->fd,
3161 SELECT_POKE_READ);
3162 }
3163 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
3164}
3165
3166static void
3167internal_send(isc__socket_t *sock) {
3168 isc_socketevent_t *dev;
3169
3170 INSIST(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
3171
3172 LOCK(&sock->lock);
3173 if (sock->fd < 0) {
3174 /* Socket is gone */
3175 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
3176 return;
3177 }
3178 dev = ISC_LIST_HEAD(sock->send_list);
3179 if (dev == NULL) {
3180 goto finish;
3181 }
3182 socket_log(sock, NULL, EVENT,
3183 "internal_send: event %p -> task %p",
3184 dev, dev->ev_sender);
3185
3186 /*
3187 * Try to do as much I/O as possible on this socket. There are no
3188 * limits here, currently.
3189 */
3190 while (dev != NULL) {
3191 switch (doio_send(sock, dev)) {
3192 case DOIO_SOFT:
3193 goto finish;
3194
3195 case DOIO_HARD:
3196 case DOIO_SUCCESS:
3197 send_senddone_event(sock, &dev);
3198 break;
3199 }
3200
3201 dev = ISC_LIST_HEAD(sock->send_list);
3202 }
3203
3204 finish:
3205 if (ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->send_list)) {
3206 unwatch_fd(&sock->manager->threads[sock->threadid],
3207 sock->fd, SELECT_POKE_WRITE);
3208 }
3209 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
3210}
3211
3212static void
3213internal_fdwatch_write(isc__socket_t *sock)
3214{
3215 int more_data;
3216
3217 INSIST(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
3218
3219 LOCK(&sock->lock);
3220 isc_refcount_increment(&sock->references);
3221 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
3222
3223 more_data = (sock->fdwatchcb)(sock->fdwatchtask, (isc_socket_t *)sock,
3224 sock->fdwatcharg, ISC_SOCKFDWATCH_WRITE);
3225
3226 LOCK(&sock->lock);
3227
3228 if (isc_refcount_decrement(&sock->references) == 0) {
3229 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
3230 destroy(&sock);
3231 return;
3232 }
3233
3234 if (more_data)
3235 select_poke(sock->manager, sock->threadid, sock->fd,
3236 SELECT_POKE_WRITE);
3237
3238 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
3239}
3240
3241static void
3242internal_fdwatch_read(isc__socket_t *sock)
3243{
3244 int more_data;
3245
3246 INSIST(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
3247
3248 LOCK(&sock->lock);
3249 isc_refcount_increment(&sock->references);
3250 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
3251
3252 more_data = (sock->fdwatchcb)(sock->fdwatchtask, (isc_socket_t *)sock,
3253 sock->fdwatcharg, ISC_SOCKFDWATCH_READ);
3254
3255 LOCK(&sock->lock);
3256
3257 if (isc_refcount_decrement(&sock->references) == 0) {
3258 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
3259 destroy(&sock);
3260 return;
3261 }
3262
3263 if (more_data)
3264 select_poke(sock->manager, sock->threadid, sock->fd,
3265 SELECT_POKE_READ);
3266
3267 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
3268}
3269
3270/*
3271 * Process read/writes on each fd here. Avoid locking
3272 * and unlocking twice if both reads and writes are possible.
3273 */
3274static void
3275process_fd(isc__socketthread_t *thread, int fd, bool readable,
3276 bool writeable)
3277{
3278 isc__socket_t *sock;
3279 int lockid = FDLOCK_ID(fd);
3280
3281 /*
3282 * If the socket is going to be closed, don't do more I/O.
3283 */
3284 LOCK(&thread->fdlock[lockid]);
3285 if (thread->fdstate[fd] == CLOSE_PENDING) {
3286 UNLOCK(&thread->fdlock[lockid]);
3287
3288 (void)unwatch_fd(thread, fd, SELECT_POKE_READ);
3289 (void)unwatch_fd(thread, fd, SELECT_POKE_WRITE);
3290 return;
3291 }
3292
3293 sock = thread->fds[fd];
3294 if (sock == NULL) {
3295 UNLOCK(&thread->fdlock[lockid]);
3296 return;
3297 }
3298
3299 if (isc_refcount_increment(&sock->references) == 0) {
3300 /*
3301 * Sock is being closed, it will be destroyed, bail.
3302 */
3303 (void)isc_refcount_decrement(&sock->references);
3304 UNLOCK(&thread->fdlock[lockid]);
3305 return;
3306 }
3307
3308 if (readable) {
3309 if (sock->listener) {
3310 internal_accept(sock);
3311 } else {
3312 dispatch_recv(sock);
3313 }
3314 }
3315
3316 if (writeable) {
3317 if (sock->connecting) {
3318 internal_connect(sock);
3319 } else {
3320 dispatch_send(sock);
3321 }
3322 }
3323
3324 UNLOCK(&thread->fdlock[lockid]);
3325 if (isc_refcount_decrement(&sock->references) == 1) {
3326 destroy(&sock);
3327 }
3328}
3329
3330/*
3331 * process_fds is different for different event loops
3332 * it takes the events from event loops and for each FD
3333 * launches process_fd
3334 */
3335#ifdef USE_KQUEUE
3336static bool
3337process_fds(isc__socketthread_t *thread, struct kevent *events,
3338 int nevents)
3339{
3340 int i;
3341 bool readable, writable;
3342 bool done = false;
3343 bool have_ctlevent = false;
3344 if (nevents == thread->nevents) {
3345 /*
3346 * This is not an error, but something unexpected. If this
3347 * happens, it may indicate the need for increasing
3348 * ISC_SOCKET_MAXEVENTS.
3349 */
3350 thread_log(thread, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
3351 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_INFO,
3352 "maximum number of FD events (%d) received",
3353 nevents);
3354 }
3355
3356 for (i = 0; i < nevents; i++) {
3357 REQUIRE(events[i].ident < thread->manager->maxsocks);
3358 if (events[i].ident == (uintptr_t)thread->pipe_fds[0]) {
3359 have_ctlevent = true;
3360 continue;
3361 }
3362 readable = (events[i].filter == EVFILT_READ);
3363 writable = (events[i].filter == EVFILT_WRITE);
3364 process_fd(thread, events[i].ident, readable, writable);
3365 }
3366
3367 if (have_ctlevent)
3368 done = process_ctlfd(thread);
3369
3370 return (done);
3371}
3372#elif defined(USE_EPOLL)
3373static bool
3374process_fds(isc__socketthread_t *thread, struct epoll_event *events,
3375 int nevents)
3376{
3377 int i;
3378 bool done = false;
3379 bool have_ctlevent = false;
3380
3381 if (nevents == thread->nevents) {
3382 thread_log(thread, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
3383 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_INFO,
3384 "maximum number of FD events (%d) received",
3385 nevents);
3386 }
3387
3388 for (i = 0; i < nevents; i++) {
3389 REQUIRE(events[i].data.fd < (int)thread->manager->maxsocks);
3390 if (events[i].data.fd == thread->pipe_fds[0]) {
3391 have_ctlevent = true;
3392 continue;
3393 }
3394 if ((events[i].events & EPOLLERR) != 0 ||
3395 (events[i].events & EPOLLHUP) != 0) {
3396 /*
3397 * epoll does not set IN/OUT bits on an erroneous
3398 * condition, so we need to try both anyway. This is a
3399 * bit inefficient, but should be okay for such rare
3400 * events. Note also that the read or write attempt
3401 * won't block because we use non-blocking sockets.
3402 */
3403 int fd = events[i].data.fd;
3404 events[i].events |= thread->epoll_events[fd];
3405 }
3406 process_fd(thread, events[i].data.fd,
3407 (events[i].events & EPOLLIN) != 0,
3408 (events[i].events & EPOLLOUT) != 0);
3409 }
3410
3411 if (have_ctlevent)
3412 done = process_ctlfd(thread);
3413
3414 return (done);
3415}
3416#elif defined(USE_DEVPOLL)
3417static bool
3418process_fds(isc__socketthread_t *thread, struct pollfd *events,
3419 int nevents)
3420{
3421 int i;
3422 bool done = false;
3423 bool have_ctlevent = false;
3424
3425 if (nevents == thread->nevents) {
3426 thread_log(thread, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
3427 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_INFO,
3428 "maximum number of FD events (%d) received",
3429 nevents);
3430 }
3431
3432 for (i = 0; i < nevents; i++) {
3433 REQUIRE(events[i].fd < (int)thread->manager->maxsocks);
3434 if (events[i].fd == thread->pipe_fds[0]) {
3435 have_ctlevent = true;
3436 continue;
3437 }
3438 process_fd(thread, events[i].fd,
3439 (events[i].events & POLLIN) != 0,
3440 (events[i].events & POLLOUT) != 0);
3441 }
3442
3443 if (have_ctlevent)
3444 done = process_ctlfd(thread);
3445
3446 return (done);
3447}
3448#elif defined(USE_SELECT)
3449static void
3450process_fds(isc__socketthread_t *thread, int maxfd, fd_set *readfds,
3451 fd_set *writefds)
3452{
3453 int i;
3454
3455 REQUIRE(maxfd <= (int)thread->manager->maxsocks);
3456
3457 for (i = 0; i < maxfd; i++) {
3458 if (i == thread->pipe_fds[0] || i == thread->pipe_fds[1])
3459 continue;
3460 process_fd(thread, i, FD_ISSET(i, readfds),
3461 FD_ISSET(i, writefds));
3462 }
3463}
3464#endif
3465
3466static bool
3467process_ctlfd(isc__socketthread_t *thread) {
3468 int msg, fd;
3469
3470 for (;;) {
3471 select_readmsg(thread, &fd, &msg);
3472
3473 thread_log(thread, IOEVENT,
3474 "watcher got message %d for socket %d", msg, fd);
3475
3476 /*
3477 * Nothing to read?
3478 */
3479 if (msg == SELECT_POKE_NOTHING)
3480 break;
3481
3482 /*
3483 * Handle shutdown message. We really should
3484 * jump out of this loop right away, but
3485 * it doesn't matter if we have to do a little
3486 * more work first.
3487 */
3488 if (msg == SELECT_POKE_SHUTDOWN)
3489 return (true);
3490
3491 /*
3492 * This is a wakeup on a socket. Look
3493 * at the event queue for both read and write,
3494 * and decide if we need to watch on it now
3495 * or not.
3496 */
3497 wakeup_socket(thread, fd, msg);
3498 }
3499
3500 return (false);
3501}
3502
3503/*
3504 * This is the thread that will loop forever, always in a select or poll
3505 * call.
3506 *
3507 * When select returns something to do, do whatever's necessary and post
3508 * an event to the task that was requesting the action.
3509 */
3510static isc_threadresult_t
3511netthread(void *uap) {
3512 isc__socketthread_t *thread = uap;
3513 isc__socketmgr_t *manager = thread->manager;
3514 (void)manager;
3515 bool done;
3516 int cc;
3517 if (manager->nthreads > 1) {
3518 isc_thread_setaffinity(thread->threadid);
3519 }
3520#ifdef USE_KQUEUE
3521 const char *fnname = "kevent()";
3522#elif defined (USE_EPOLL)
3523 const char *fnname = "epoll_wait()";
3524#elif defined(USE_DEVPOLL)
3525 isc_result_t result;
3526 const char *fnname = "ioctl(DP_POLL)";
3527 struct dvpoll dvp;
3528 int pass;
3529#if defined(ISC_SOCKET_USE_POLLWATCH)
3530 pollstate_t pollstate = poll_idle;
3531#endif
3532#elif defined (USE_SELECT)
3533 const char *fnname = "select()";
3534 int maxfd;
3535 int ctlfd;
3536#endif
3537 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
3538
3539#if defined (USE_SELECT)
3540 /*
3541 * Get the control fd here. This will never change.
3542 */
3543 ctlfd = thread->pipe_fds[0];
3544#endif
3545 done = false;
3546 while (!done) {
3547 do {
3548#ifdef USE_KQUEUE
3549 cc = kevent(thread->kqueue_fd, NULL, 0,
3550 thread->events, thread->nevents, NULL);
3551#elif defined(USE_EPOLL)
3552 cc = epoll_wait(thread->epoll_fd,
3553 thread->events,
3554 thread->nevents, -1);
3555#elif defined(USE_DEVPOLL)
3556 /*
3557 * Re-probe every thousand calls.
3558 */
3559 if (thread->calls++ > 1000U) {
3560 result = isc_resource_getcurlimit(
3561 isc_resource_openfiles,
3562 &thread->open_max);
3563 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
3564 thread->open_max = 64;
3565 }
3566 thread->calls = 0;
3567 }
3568 for (pass = 0; pass < 2; pass++) {
3569 dvp.dp_fds = thread->events;
3570 dvp.dp_nfds = thread->nevents;
3571 if (dvp.dp_nfds >= thread->open_max) {
3572 dvp.dp_nfds = thread->open_max - 1;
3573 }
3574#ifndef ISC_SOCKET_USE_POLLWATCH
3575 dvp.dp_timeout = -1;
3576#else
3577 if (pollstate == poll_idle) {
3578 dvp.dp_timeout = -1;
3579 } else {
3580 dvp.dp_timeout =
3581 ISC_SOCKET_POLLWATCH_TIMEOUT;
3582 }
3583#endif /* ISC_SOCKET_USE_POLLWATCH */
3584 cc = ioctl(thread->devpoll_fd, DP_POLL, &dvp);
3585 if (cc == -1 && errno == EINVAL) {
3586 /*
3587 * {OPEN_MAX} may have dropped. Look
3588 * up the current value and try again.
3589 */
3590 result = isc_resource_getcurlimit(
3591 isc_resource_openfiles,
3592 &thread->open_max);
3593 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
3594 thread->open_max = 64;
3595 }
3596 } else {
3597 break;
3598 }
3599 }
3600#elif defined(USE_SELECT)
3601 /*
3602 * We will have only one thread anyway, we can lock
3603 * manager lock and don't care
3604 */
3605 LOCK(&manager->lock);
3606 memmove(thread->read_fds_copy, thread->read_fds,
3607 thread->fd_bufsize);
3608 memmove(thread->write_fds_copy, thread->write_fds,
3609 thread->fd_bufsize);
3610 maxfd = thread->maxfd + 1;
3611 UNLOCK(&manager->lock);
3612
3613 cc = select(maxfd, thread->read_fds_copy,
3614 thread->write_fds_copy, NULL, NULL);
3615#endif /* USE_KQUEUE */
3616
3617 if (cc < 0 && !SOFT_ERROR(errno)) {
3618 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
3619 FATAL_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
3620 "%s failed: %s", fnname, strbuf);
3621 }
3622
3623#if defined(USE_DEVPOLL) && defined(ISC_SOCKET_USE_POLLWATCH)
3624 if (cc == 0) {
3625 if (pollstate == poll_active) {
3626 pollstate = poll_checking;
3627 } else if (pollstate == poll_checking) {
3628 pollstate = poll_idle;
3629 }
3630 } else if (cc > 0) {
3631 if (pollstate == poll_checking) {
3632 /*
3633 * XXX: We'd like to use a more
3634 * verbose log level as it's actually an
3635 * unexpected event, but the kernel bug
3636 * reportedly happens pretty frequently
3637 * (and it can also be a false positive)
3638 * so it would be just too noisy.
3639 */
3640 thread_log(thread,
3641 ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
3642 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET,
3643 ISC_LOG_DEBUG(1),
3644 "unexpected POLL timeout");
3645 }
3646 pollstate = poll_active;
3647 }
3648#endif
3649 } while (cc < 0);
3650
3651#if defined(USE_KQUEUE) || defined (USE_EPOLL) || defined (USE_DEVPOLL)
3652 done = process_fds(thread, thread->events, cc);
3653#elif defined(USE_SELECT)
3654 process_fds(thread, maxfd, thread->read_fds_copy,
3655 thread->write_fds_copy);
3656
3657 /*
3658 * Process reads on internal, control fd.
3659 */
3660 if (FD_ISSET(ctlfd, thread->read_fds_copy)) {
3661 done = process_ctlfd(thread);
3662 }
3663#endif
3664 }
3665
3666 thread_log(thread, TRACE, "watcher exiting");
3667 return ((isc_threadresult_t)0);
3668}

3687
3688/*
3689 * Setup socket thread, thread->manager and thread->threadid must be filled.
3690 */
3691
3692static isc_result_t
3693setup_thread(isc__socketthread_t *thread) {
3694 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
3695 int i;
3696 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
3697
3698 REQUIRE(thread != NULL);
3699 REQUIRE(VALID_MANAGER(thread->manager));
3700 REQUIRE(thread->threadid >= 0 &&
3701 thread->threadid < thread->manager->nthreads);
3702
3703 thread->fds = isc_mem_get(thread->manager->mctx,
3704 thread->manager->maxsocks *
3705 sizeof(isc__socket_t *));
3706
3707 memset(thread->fds, 0,
3708 thread->manager->maxsocks * sizeof(isc_socket_t *));
3709
3710 thread->fdstate = isc_mem_get(thread->manager->mctx,
3711 thread->manager->maxsocks * sizeof(int));
3712
3713 memset(thread->fdstate, 0, thread->manager->maxsocks * sizeof(int));
3714
3715 thread->fdlock = isc_mem_get(thread->manager->mctx,
3716 FDLOCK_COUNT * sizeof(isc_mutex_t));
3717
3718 for (i = 0; i < FDLOCK_COUNT; i++) {
3719 isc_mutex_init(&thread->fdlock[i]);
3720 }
3721
3722 if (pipe(thread->pipe_fds) != 0) {
3723 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
3724 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
3725 "pipe() failed: %s",
3726 strbuf);
3727 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
3728 }
3729 RUNTIME_CHECK(make_nonblock(thread->pipe_fds[0]) == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
3730
3731#ifdef USE_KQUEUE
3732 thread->nevents = ISC_SOCKET_MAXEVENTS;
3733 thread->events = isc_mem_get(thread->manager->mctx,
3734 sizeof(struct kevent) * thread->nevents);
3735
3736 thread->kqueue_fd = kqueue();
3737 if (thread->kqueue_fd == -1) {
3738 result = isc__errno2result(errno);
3739 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
3740 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
3741 "kqueue failed: %s",
3742 strbuf);
3743 isc_mem_put(thread->manager->mctx, thread->events,
3744 sizeof(struct kevent) * thread->nevents);
3745 return (result);
3746 }
3747
3748 result = watch_fd(thread, thread->pipe_fds[0], SELECT_POKE_READ);
3749 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
3750 close(thread->kqueue_fd);
3751 isc_mem_put(thread->manager->mctx, thread->events,
3752 sizeof(struct kevent) * thread->nevents);
3753 }
3754 return (result);
3755
3756#elif defined(USE_EPOLL)
3757 thread->nevents = ISC_SOCKET_MAXEVENTS;
3758 thread->epoll_events = isc_mem_get(thread->manager->mctx,
3759 (thread->manager->maxsocks *
3760 sizeof(uint32_t)));
3761
3762 memset(thread->epoll_events, 0,
3763 thread->manager->maxsocks * sizeof(uint32_t));
3764
3765 thread->events = isc_mem_get(thread->manager->mctx,
3766 sizeof(struct epoll_event) *
3767 thread->nevents);
3768
3769 thread->epoll_fd = epoll_create(thread->nevents);
3770 if (thread->epoll_fd == -1) {
3771 result = isc__errno2result(errno);
3772 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
3773 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
3774 "epoll_create failed: %s",
3775 strbuf);
3776 return (result);
3777
3778 }
3779
3780 result = watch_fd(thread, thread->pipe_fds[0], SELECT_POKE_READ);
3781 return (result);
3782
3783#elif defined(USE_DEVPOLL)
3784 thread->nevents = ISC_SOCKET_MAXEVENTS;
3785 result = isc_resource_getcurlimit(isc_resource_openfiles,
3786 &thread->open_max);
3787 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
3788 thread->open_max = 64;
3789 thread->calls = 0;
3790 thread->events = isc_mem_get(thread->manager->mctx,
3791 sizeof(struct pollfd) * thread->nevents);
3792
3793 /*
3794 * Note: fdpollinfo should be able to support all possible FDs, so
3795 * it must have maxsocks entries (not nevents).
3796 */
3797 thread->fdpollinfo = isc_mem_get(thread->manager->mctx,
3798 sizeof(pollinfo_t) *
3799 thread->manager->maxsocks);
3800 memset(thread->fdpollinfo, 0, sizeof(pollinfo_t) *
3801 thread->manager->maxsocks);
3802 thread->devpoll_fd = open("/dev/poll", O_RDWR);
3803 if (thread->devpoll_fd == -1) {
3804 result = isc__errno2result(errno);
3805 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
3806 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
3807 "open(/dev/poll) failed: %s",
3808 strbuf);
3809 isc_mem_put(thread->manager->mctx, thread->events,
3810 sizeof(struct pollfd) * thread->nevents);
3811 isc_mem_put(thread->manager->mctx, thread->fdpollinfo,
3812 sizeof(pollinfo_t) * thread->manager->maxsocks);
3813 return (result);
3814 }
3815 result = watch_fd(thread, thread->pipe_fds[0], SELECT_POKE_READ);
3816 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
3817 close(thread->devpoll_fd);
3818 isc_mem_put(thread->manager->mctx, thread->events,
3819 sizeof(struct pollfd) * thread->nevents);
3820 isc_mem_put(thread->manager->mctx, thread->fdpollinfo,
3821 sizeof(pollinfo_t) * thread->manager->maxsocks);
3822 return (result);
3823 }
3824
3825 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
3826#elif defined(USE_SELECT)
3827 UNUSED(result);
3828
3829#if ISC_SOCKET_MAXSOCKETS > FD_SETSIZE
3830 /*
3831 * Note: this code should also cover the case of MAXSOCKETS <=
3832 * FD_SETSIZE, but we separate the cases to avoid possible portability
3833 * issues regarding howmany() and the actual representation of fd_set.
3834 */
3835 thread->fd_bufsize =
3836 howmany(manager->maxsocks, NFDBITS) * sizeof(fd_mask);
3837#else
3838 thread->fd_bufsize = sizeof(fd_set);
3839#endif
3840
3841 thread->read_fds = isc_mem_get(thread->manager->mctx,
3842 thread->fd_bufsize);
3843 thread->read_fds_copy = isc_mem_get(thread->manager->mctx,
3844 thread->fd_bufsize);
3845 thread->write_fds = isc_mem_get(thread->manager->mctx,
3846 thread->fd_bufsize);
3847 thread->write_fds_copy = isc_mem_get(thread->manager->mctx,
3848 thread->fd_bufsize);
3849 memset(thread->read_fds, 0, thread->fd_bufsize);
3850 memset(thread->write_fds, 0, thread->fd_bufsize);
3851
3852 (void)watch_fd(thread, thread->pipe_fds[0], SELECT_POKE_READ);
3853 thread->maxfd = thread->pipe_fds[0];
3854
3855 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
3856#endif /* USE_KQUEUE */
3857}
3858
3859static void
3860cleanup_thread(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc__socketthread_t *thread) {
3861 isc_result_t result;
3862 int i;
3863
3864 result = unwatch_fd(thread, thread->pipe_fds[0], SELECT_POKE_READ);
3865 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
3866 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
3867 "epoll_ctl(DEL) failed");
3868 }
3869#ifdef USE_KQUEUE
3870 close(thread->kqueue_fd);
3871 isc_mem_put(mctx, thread->events,
3872 sizeof(struct kevent) * thread->nevents);
3873#elif defined(USE_EPOLL)
3874 close(thread->epoll_fd);
3875
3876 isc_mem_put(mctx, thread->events,
3877 sizeof(struct epoll_event) * thread->nevents);
3878#elif defined(USE_DEVPOLL)
3879 close(thread->devpoll_fd);
3880 isc_mem_put(mctx, thread->events,
3881 sizeof(struct pollfd) * thread->nevents);
3882 isc_mem_put(mctx, thread->fdpollinfo,
3883 sizeof(pollinfo_t) * thread->manager->maxsocks);
3884#elif defined(USE_SELECT)
3885 if (thread->read_fds != NULL) {
3886 isc_mem_put(mctx, thread->read_fds, thread->fd_bufsize);
3887 }
3888 if (thread->read_fds_copy != NULL) {
3889 isc_mem_put(mctx, thread->read_fds_copy, thread->fd_bufsize);
3890 }
3891 if (thread->write_fds != NULL) {
3892 isc_mem_put(mctx, thread->write_fds, thread->fd_bufsize);
3893 }
3894 if (thread->write_fds_copy != NULL) {
3895 isc_mem_put(mctx, thread->write_fds_copy, thread->fd_bufsize);
3896 }
3897#endif /* USE_KQUEUE */
3898 for (i = 0; i < (int)thread->manager->maxsocks; i++) {
3899 if (thread->fdstate[i] == CLOSE_PENDING) {
3900 /* no need to lock */
3901 (void)close(i);
3902 }
3903 }
3904
3905#if defined(USE_EPOLL)
3906 isc_mem_put(thread->manager->mctx, thread->epoll_events,
3907 thread->manager->maxsocks * sizeof(uint32_t));
3908#endif
3909 isc_mem_put(thread->manager->mctx, thread->fds,
3910 thread->manager->maxsocks * sizeof(isc__socket_t *));
3911 isc_mem_put(thread->manager->mctx, thread->fdstate,
3912 thread->manager->maxsocks * sizeof(int));
3913
3914
3915 if (thread->fdlock != NULL) {
3916 for (i = 0; i < FDLOCK_COUNT; i++) {
3917 isc_mutex_destroy(&thread->fdlock[i]);
3918 }
3919 isc_mem_put(thread->manager->mctx, thread->fdlock,
3920 FDLOCK_COUNT * sizeof(isc_mutex_t));
3921 }
3922
3923}
3924
3925isc_result_t
3926isc_socketmgr_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_socketmgr_t **managerp) {
3927 return (isc_socketmgr_create2(mctx, managerp, 0, 1));
3928}
3929
3930isc_result_t
3931isc_socketmgr_create2(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_socketmgr_t **managerp,
3932 unsigned int maxsocks, int nthreads)
3933{
3934 int i;
3935 isc__socketmgr_t *manager;
3936
3937 REQUIRE(managerp != NULL && *managerp == NULL);
3938
3939 if (maxsocks == 0)
3940 maxsocks = ISC_SOCKET_MAXSOCKETS;
3941
3942 manager = isc_mem_get(mctx, sizeof(*manager));
3943
3944 /* zero-clear so that necessary cleanup on failure will be easy */
3945 memset(manager, 0, sizeof(*manager));
3946 manager->maxsocks = maxsocks;
3947 manager->reserved = 0;
3948 manager->maxudp = 0;
3949 manager->nthreads = nthreads;
3950 manager->stats = NULL;
3951
3952 manager->common.magic = ISCAPI_SOCKETMGR_MAGIC;
3953 manager->common.impmagic = SOCKET_MANAGER_MAGIC;
3954 manager->mctx = NULL;
3955 ISC_LIST_INIT(manager->socklist);
3956 isc_mutex_init(&manager->lock);
3957 isc_condition_init(&manager->shutdown_ok);
3958
3959 /*
3960 * Start up the select/poll thread.
3961 */
3962 manager->threads = isc_mem_get(mctx, sizeof(isc__socketthread_t)
3963 * manager->nthreads);
3964 isc_mem_attach(mctx, &manager->mctx);
3965
3966 for (i=0; i < manager->nthreads; i++) {
3967 manager->threads[i].manager = manager;
3968 manager->threads[i].threadid = i;
3969 setup_thread(&manager->threads[i]);
3970 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_thread_create(netthread,
3971 &manager->threads[i],
3972 &manager->threads[i].thread)
3973 == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
3974 char tname[128];
3975 snprintf(tname, sizeof(tname), "sock-%d", i);
3976 isc_thread_setname(manager->threads[i].thread, tname);
3977 }
3978
3979 *managerp = (isc_socketmgr_t *)manager;
3980
3981 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
3982
3983}

3986isc_socketmgr_getmaxsockets(isc_socketmgr_t *manager0, unsigned int *nsockp) {
3987 isc__socketmgr_t *manager = (isc__socketmgr_t *)manager0;
3988 REQUIRE(VALID_MANAGER(manager));
3989 REQUIRE(nsockp != NULL);
3990
3991 *nsockp = manager->maxsocks;
3992
3993 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
3994}

3996void
3997isc_socketmgr_setstats(isc_socketmgr_t *manager0, isc_stats_t *stats) {
3998 isc__socketmgr_t *manager = (isc__socketmgr_t *)manager0;
3999
4000 REQUIRE(VALID_MANAGER(manager));
4001 REQUIRE(ISC_LIST_EMPTY(manager->socklist));
4002 REQUIRE(manager->stats == NULL);
4003 REQUIRE(isc_stats_ncounters(stats) == isc_sockstatscounter_max);
4004

4007
4008void
4009isc_socketmgr_destroy(isc_socketmgr_t **managerp) {
4010 isc__socketmgr_t *manager;
4011 isc_mem_t *mctx;
4012 int i;
4013
4014 /*
4015 * Destroy a socket manager.
4016 */
4017
4018 REQUIRE(managerp != NULL);
4019 manager = (isc__socketmgr_t *)*managerp;
4020 REQUIRE(VALID_MANAGER(manager));
4021
4022 LOCK(&manager->lock);
4023
4024 /*
4025 * Wait for all sockets to be destroyed.
4026 */
4027 while (!ISC_LIST_EMPTY(manager->socklist)) {
4028 manager_log(manager, CREATION, "sockets exist");
4029 WAIT(&manager->shutdown_ok, &manager->lock);
4030 }
4031
4032 UNLOCK(&manager->lock);
4033
4034 /*
4035 * Here, poke our select/poll thread. Do this by closing the write
4036 * half of the pipe, which will send EOF to the read half.
4037 * This is currently a no-op in the non-threaded case.
4038 */
4039 for (i = 0; i < manager->nthreads; i++) {
4040 select_poke(manager, i, 0, SELECT_POKE_SHUTDOWN);
4041 }
4042
4043 /*
4044 * Wait for thread to exit.
4045 */
4046 for (i = 0; i < manager->nthreads; i++) {
4047 isc_result_t result;
4048 result = isc_thread_join(manager->threads[i].thread, NULL);
4049 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
4050 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
4051 "isc_thread_join() failed");
4052 }
4053 cleanup_thread(manager->mctx, &manager->threads[i]);
4054 }
4055 /*
4056 * Clean up.
4057 */
4058 isc_mem_put(manager->mctx, manager->threads,
4059 sizeof(isc__socketthread_t) * manager->nthreads);
4060 (void)isc_condition_destroy(&manager->shutdown_ok);
4061
4062 if (manager->stats != NULL) {
4063 isc_stats_detach(&manager->stats);
4064 }
4065 isc_mutex_destroy(&manager->lock);
4066 manager->common.magic = 0;
4067 manager->common.impmagic = 0;
4068 mctx= manager->mctx;
4069 isc_mem_put(mctx, manager, sizeof(*manager));
4070
4071 isc_mem_detach(&mctx);
4072
4073 *managerp = NULL;
4074
4075}
4076
4077static isc_result_t
4078socket_recv(isc__socket_t *sock, isc_socketevent_t *dev, isc_task_t *task,
4079 unsigned int flags)
4080{
4081 int io_state;
4082 bool have_lock = false;
4083 isc_task_t *ntask = NULL;
4084 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
4085
4086 dev->ev_sender = task;
4087
4088 if (sock->type == isc_sockettype_udp) {
4089 io_state = doio_recv(sock, dev);
4090 } else {
4091 LOCK(&sock->lock);
4092 have_lock = true;
4093
4094 if (ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->recv_list)) {
4095 io_state = doio_recv(sock, dev);
4096 } else {
4097 io_state = DOIO_SOFT;
4098 }
4099 }
4100
4101 switch (io_state) {
4102 case DOIO_SOFT:
4103 /*
4104 * We couldn't read all or part of the request right now, so
4105 * queue it.
4106 *
4107 * Attach to socket and to task
4108 */
4109 isc_task_attach(task, &ntask);
4110 dev->attributes |= ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_ATTACHED;
4111
4112 if (!have_lock) {
4113 LOCK(&sock->lock);
4114 have_lock = true;
4115 }
4116
4117 /*
4118 * Enqueue the request. If the socket was previously not being
4119 * watched, poke the watcher to start paying attention to it.
4120 */
4121 bool do_poke = ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->recv_list);
4122 ISC_LIST_ENQUEUE(sock->recv_list, dev, ev_link);
4123 if (do_poke) {
4124 select_poke(sock->manager, sock->threadid, sock->fd,
4125 SELECT_POKE_READ);
4126 }
4127
4128 socket_log(sock, NULL, EVENT,
4129 "socket_recv: event %p -> task %p",
4130 dev, ntask);
4131
4132 if ((flags & ISC_SOCKFLAG_IMMEDIATE) != 0) {
4133 result = ISC_R_INPROGRESS;
4134 }
4135 break;
4136
4137 case DOIO_EOF:
4138 dev->result = ISC_R_EOF;
4139 /* fallthrough */
4140
4141 case DOIO_HARD:
4142 case DOIO_SUCCESS:
4143 if ((flags & ISC_SOCKFLAG_IMMEDIATE) == 0) {
4144 send_recvdone_event(sock, &dev);
4145 }
4146 break;
4147 }
4148
4149 if (have_lock) {
4150 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
4151 }
4152
4153 return (result);
4154}
4155
4156isc_result_t
4157isc_socket_recv(isc_socket_t *sock0, isc_region_t *region,
4158 unsigned int minimum, isc_task_t *task,
4159 isc_taskaction_t action, void *arg)
4160{
4161 isc__socket_t *sock = (isc__socket_t *)sock0;
4162 isc_socketevent_t *dev;
4163 isc__socketmgr_t *manager;
4164
4165 REQUIRE(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
4166 REQUIRE(action != NULL);
4167
4168 manager = sock->manager;
4169 REQUIRE(VALID_MANAGER(manager));
4170
4171 INSIST(sock->bound);
4172
4173 dev = allocate_socketevent(manager->mctx, sock,
4174 ISC_SOCKEVENT_RECVDONE, action, arg);
4175 if (dev == NULL)
4176 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
4177
4178 return (isc_socket_recv2(sock0, region, minimum, task, dev, 0));
4179}
4180
4181isc_result_t
4182isc_socket_recv2(isc_socket_t *sock0, isc_region_t *region,
4183 unsigned int minimum, isc_task_t *task,
4184 isc_socketevent_t *event, unsigned int flags)
4185{
4186 isc__socket_t *sock = (isc__socket_t *)sock0;
4187
4188 event->ev_sender = sock;
4189 event->result = ISC_R_UNSET;
4190 event->region = *region;
4191 event->n = 0;
4192 event->offset = 0;
4193 event->attributes = 0;
4194
4195 /*
4196 * UDP sockets are always partial read.
4197 */
4198 if (sock->type == isc_sockettype_udp)
4199 event->minimum = 1;
4200 else {
4201 if (minimum == 0)
4202 event->minimum = region->length;
4203 else
4204 event->minimum = minimum;
4205 }
4206
4207 return (socket_recv(sock, event, task, flags));
4208}
4209
4210static isc_result_t
4211socket_send(isc__socket_t *sock, isc_socketevent_t *dev, isc_task_t *task,
4212 const isc_sockaddr_t *address, struct in6_pktinfo *pktinfo,
4213 unsigned int flags)
4214{
4215 int io_state;
4216 bool have_lock = false;
4217 isc_task_t *ntask = NULL;
4218 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
4219
4220 dev->ev_sender = task;
4221
4222 set_dev_address(address, sock, dev);
4223 if (pktinfo != NULL) {
4224 dev->attributes |= ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_PKTINFO;
4225 dev->pktinfo = *pktinfo;
4226
4227 if (!isc_sockaddr_issitelocal(&dev->address) &&
4228 !isc_sockaddr_islinklocal(&dev->address)) {
4229 socket_log(sock, NULL, TRACE,
4230 "pktinfo structure provided, ifindex %u (set to 0)",
4231 pktinfo->ipi6_ifindex);
4232
4233 /*
4234 * Set the pktinfo index to 0 here, to let the
4235 * kernel decide what interface it should send on.
4236 */
4237 dev->pktinfo.ipi6_ifindex = 0;
4238 }
4239 }
4240
4241 if (sock->type == isc_sockettype_udp) {
4242 io_state = doio_send(sock, dev);
4243 } else {
4244 LOCK(&sock->lock);
4245 have_lock = true;
4246
4247 if (ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->send_list)) {
4248 io_state = doio_send(sock, dev);
4249 } else {
4250 io_state = DOIO_SOFT;
4251 }
4252 }
4253
4254 switch (io_state) {
4255 case DOIO_SOFT:
4256 /*
4257 * We couldn't send all or part of the request right now, so
4258 * queue it unless ISC_SOCKFLAG_NORETRY is set.
4259 */
4260 if ((flags & ISC_SOCKFLAG_NORETRY) == 0) {
4261 isc_task_attach(task, &ntask);
4262 dev->attributes |= ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_ATTACHED;
4263
4264 if (!have_lock) {
4265 LOCK(&sock->lock);
4266 have_lock = true;
4267 }
4268
4269 /*
4270 * Enqueue the request. If the socket was previously
4271 * not being watched, poke the watcher to start
4272 * paying attention to it.
4273 */
4274 bool do_poke = ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->send_list);
4275 ISC_LIST_ENQUEUE(sock->send_list, dev, ev_link);
4276 if (do_poke) {
4277 select_poke(sock->manager, sock->threadid,
4278 sock->fd,
4279 SELECT_POKE_WRITE);
4280 }
4281 socket_log(sock, NULL, EVENT,
4282 "socket_send: event %p -> task %p",
4283 dev, ntask);
4284
4285 if ((flags & ISC_SOCKFLAG_IMMEDIATE) != 0) {
4286 result = ISC_R_INPROGRESS;
4287 }
4288 break;
4289 }
4290
4291 /* FALLTHROUGH */
4292
4293 case DOIO_HARD:
4294 case DOIO_SUCCESS:
4295 if ((flags & ISC_SOCKFLAG_IMMEDIATE) == 0) {
4296 send_senddone_event(sock, &dev);
4297 }
4298 break;
4299 }
4300
4301 if (have_lock) {
4302 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
4303 }
4304
4305 return (result);
4306}
4307
4308isc_result_t
4309isc_socket_send(isc_socket_t *sock, isc_region_t *region,
4310 isc_task_t *task, isc_taskaction_t action, void *arg)
4311{
4312 /*
4313 * REQUIRE() checking is performed in isc_socket_sendto().
4314 */
4315 return (isc_socket_sendto(sock, region, task, action, arg, NULL,
4316 NULL));
4317}
4318
4319isc_result_t
4320isc_socket_sendto(isc_socket_t *sock0, isc_region_t *region,
4321 isc_task_t *task, isc_taskaction_t action, void *arg,
4322 const isc_sockaddr_t *address, struct in6_pktinfo *pktinfo)
4323{
4324 isc__socket_t *sock = (isc__socket_t *)sock0;
4325 isc_socketevent_t *dev;
4326 isc__socketmgr_t *manager;
4327
4328 REQUIRE(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
4329 REQUIRE(region != NULL);
4330 REQUIRE(task != NULL);
4331 REQUIRE(action != NULL);
4332
4333 manager = sock->manager;
4334 REQUIRE(VALID_MANAGER(manager));
4335
4336 INSIST(sock->bound);
4337
4338 dev = allocate_socketevent(manager->mctx, sock,
4339 ISC_SOCKEVENT_SENDDONE, action, arg);
4340 if (dev == NULL)
4341 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
4342
4343 dev->region = *region;
4344
4345 return (socket_send(sock, dev, task, address, pktinfo, 0));
4346}
4347
4348isc_result_t
4349isc_socket_sendto2(isc_socket_t *sock0, isc_region_t *region,
4350 isc_task_t *task,
4351 const isc_sockaddr_t *address, struct in6_pktinfo *pktinfo,
4352 isc_socketevent_t *event, unsigned int flags)
4353{
4354 isc__socket_t *sock = (isc__socket_t *)sock0;
4355
4356 REQUIRE(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
4357 REQUIRE((flags & ~(ISC_SOCKFLAG_IMMEDIATE|ISC_SOCKFLAG_NORETRY)) == 0);
4358 if ((flags & ISC_SOCKFLAG_NORETRY) != 0)
4359 REQUIRE(sock->type == isc_sockettype_udp);
4360 event->ev_sender = sock;
4361 event->result = ISC_R_UNSET;
4362 event->region = *region;
4363 event->n = 0;
4364 event->offset = 0;
4365 event->attributes &= ~ISC_SOCKEVENTATTR_ATTACHED;
4366
4367 return (socket_send(sock, event, task, address, pktinfo, flags));
4368}
4369
4370void
4371isc_socket_cleanunix(const isc_sockaddr_t *sockaddr, bool active) {
4372#ifdef ISC_PLATFORM_HAVESYSUNH
4373 int s;
4374 struct stat sb;
4375 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
4376
4377 if (sockaddr->type.sa.sa_family != AF_UNIX)
4378 return;
4379
4380#ifndef S_ISSOCK
4381#if defined(S_IFMT) && defined(S_IFSOCK)
4382#define S_ISSOCK(mode) ((mode & S_IFMT)==S_IFSOCK)
4383#elif defined(_S_IFMT) && defined(S_IFSOCK)
4384#define S_ISSOCK(mode) ((mode & _S_IFMT)==S_IFSOCK)
4385#endif
4386#endif
4387
4388#ifndef S_ISFIFO
4389#if defined(S_IFMT) && defined(S_IFIFO)
4390#define S_ISFIFO(mode) ((mode & S_IFMT)==S_IFIFO)
4391#elif defined(_S_IFMT) && defined(S_IFIFO)
4392#define S_ISFIFO(mode) ((mode & _S_IFMT)==S_IFIFO)
4393#endif
4394#endif
4395
4396#if !defined(S_ISFIFO) && !defined(S_ISSOCK)
4397#error You need to define S_ISFIFO and S_ISSOCK as appropriate for your platform. See <sys/stat.h>.
4398#endif
4399
4400#ifndef S_ISFIFO
4401#define S_ISFIFO(mode) 0
4402#endif
4403
4404#ifndef S_ISSOCK
4405#define S_ISSOCK(mode) 0
4406#endif
4407
4408 if (active) {
4409 if (stat(sockaddr->type.sunix.sun_path, &sb) < 0) {
4410 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
4411 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
4412 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
4413 "isc_socket_cleanunix: stat(%s): %s",
4414 sockaddr->type.sunix.sun_path, strbuf);
4415 return;
4416 }
4417 if (!(S_ISSOCK(sb.st_mode) || S_ISFIFO(sb.st_mode))) {
4418 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
4419 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
4420 "isc_socket_cleanunix: %s: not a socket",
4421 sockaddr->type.sunix.sun_path);
4422 return;
4423 }
4424 if (unlink(sockaddr->type.sunix.sun_path) < 0) {
4425 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
4426 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
4427 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
4428 "isc_socket_cleanunix: unlink(%s): %s",
4429 sockaddr->type.sunix.sun_path, strbuf);
4430 }
4431 return;
4432 }
4433
4434 s = socket(AF_UNIX, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
4435 if (s < 0) {
4436 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
4437 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
4438 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_WARNING,
4439 "isc_socket_cleanunix: socket(%s): %s",
4440 sockaddr->type.sunix.sun_path, strbuf);
4441 return;
4442 }
4443
4444 if (stat(sockaddr->type.sunix.sun_path, &sb) < 0) {
4445 switch (errno) {
4446 case ENOENT: /* We exited cleanly last time */
4447 break;
4448 default:
4449 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
4450 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
4451 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_WARNING,
4452 "isc_socket_cleanunix: stat(%s): %s",
4453 sockaddr->type.sunix.sun_path, strbuf);
4454 break;
4455 }
4456 goto cleanup;
4457 }
4458
4459 if (!(S_ISSOCK(sb.st_mode) || S_ISFIFO(sb.st_mode))) {
4460 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
4461 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_WARNING,
4462 "isc_socket_cleanunix: %s: not a socket",
4463 sockaddr->type.sunix.sun_path);
4464 goto cleanup;
4465 }
4466
4467 if (connect(s, (const struct sockaddr *)&sockaddr->type.sunix,
4468 sizeof(sockaddr->type.sunix)) < 0) {
4469 switch (errno) {
4470 case ECONNREFUSED:
4471 case ECONNRESET:
4472 if (unlink(sockaddr->type.sunix.sun_path) < 0) {
4473 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
4474 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
4475 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET,
4476 ISC_LOG_WARNING,
4477 "isc_socket_cleanunix: "
4478 "unlink(%s): %s",
4479 sockaddr->type.sunix.sun_path,
4480 strbuf);
4481 }
4482 break;
4483 default:
4484 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
4485 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
4486 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_WARNING,
4487 "isc_socket_cleanunix: connect(%s): %s",
4488 sockaddr->type.sunix.sun_path, strbuf);
4489 break;
4490 }
4491 }
4492 cleanup:
4493 close(s);
4494#else
4495 UNUSED(sockaddr);
4496 UNUSED(active);
4497#endif
4498}
4499
4500isc_result_t
4501isc_socket_permunix(const isc_sockaddr_t *sockaddr, uint32_t perm,
4502 uint32_t owner, uint32_t group)
4503{
4504#ifdef ISC_PLATFORM_HAVESYSUNH
4505 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
4506 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
4507 char path[sizeof(sockaddr->type.sunix.sun_path)];
4508#ifdef NEED_SECURE_DIRECTORY
4509 char *slash;
4510#endif
4511
4512 REQUIRE(sockaddr->type.sa.sa_family == AF_UNIX);
4513 INSIST(strlen(sockaddr->type.sunix.sun_path) < sizeof(path));
4514 strlcpy(path, sockaddr->type.sunix.sun_path, sizeof(path));
4515
4516#ifdef NEED_SECURE_DIRECTORY
4517 slash = strrchr(path, '/');
4518 if (slash != NULL) {
4519 if (slash != path) {
4520 *slash = '\0';
4521 } else {
4522 strlcpy(path, "/", sizeof(path));
4523 }
4524 } else {
4525 strlcpy(path, ".", sizeof(path));
4526 }
4527#endif
4528
4529 if (chmod(path, perm) < 0) {
4530 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
4531 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
4532 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
4533 "isc_socket_permunix: chmod(%s, %d): %s",
4534 path, perm, strbuf);
4535 result = ISC_R_FAILURE;
4536 }
4537 if (chown(path, owner, group) < 0) {
4538 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
4539 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
4540 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
4541 "isc_socket_permunix: chown(%s, %d, %d): %s",
4542 path, owner, group,
4543 strbuf);
4544 result = ISC_R_FAILURE;
4545 }
4546 return (result);
4547#else
4548 UNUSED(sockaddr);
4549 UNUSED(perm);
4550 UNUSED(owner);
4551 UNUSED(group);
4552 return (ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED);
4553#endif
4554}
4555
4556isc_result_t
4557isc_socket_bind(isc_socket_t *sock0, const isc_sockaddr_t *sockaddr,
4558 isc_socket_options_t options)
4559{
4560 isc__socket_t *sock = (isc__socket_t *)sock0;
4561 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
4562 int on = 1;
4563
4564 REQUIRE(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
4565
4566 LOCK(&sock->lock);
4567
4568 INSIST(!sock->bound);
4569 INSIST(!sock->dupped);
4570
4571 if (sock->pf != sockaddr->type.sa.sa_family) {
4572 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
4573 return (ISC_R_FAMILYMISMATCH);
4574 }
4575
4576 /*
4577 * Only set SO_REUSEADDR when we want a specific port.
4578 */
4579#ifdef AF_UNIX
4580 if (sock->pf == AF_UNIX) {
4581 goto bind_socket;
4582 }
4583#endif
4584 if ((options & ISC_SOCKET_REUSEADDRESS) != 0 &&
4585 isc_sockaddr_getport(sockaddr) != (in_port_t) 0)
4586 {
4587 if (setsockopt(sock->fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR,
4588 (void *)&on, sizeof(on)) < 0)
4589 {
4590 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
4591 "setsockopt(%d) failed", sock->fd);
4592 }
4593 if (setsockopt(sock->fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEPORT,
4594 (void *)&on, sizeof(on)) < 0)
4595 {
4596 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
4597 "setsockopt(%d) failed", sock->fd);
4598 }
4599 /* Press on... */
4600 }
4601#ifdef AF_UNIX
4602 bind_socket:
4603#endif
4604 if (bind(sock->fd, &sockaddr->type.sa, sockaddr->length) < 0) {
4605 inc_stats(sock->manager->stats,
4606 sock->statsindex[STATID_BINDFAIL]);
4607
4608 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
4609 switch (errno) {
4610 case EACCES:
4611 return (ISC_R_NOPERM);
4612 case EADDRNOTAVAIL:
4613 return (ISC_R_ADDRNOTAVAIL);
4614 case EADDRINUSE:
4615 return (ISC_R_ADDRINUSE);
4616 case EINVAL:
4617 return (ISC_R_BOUND);
4618 default:
4619 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
4620 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__, "bind: %s",
4621 strbuf);
4622 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
4623 }
4624 }
4625
4626 socket_log(sock, sockaddr, TRACE, "bound");
4627 sock->bound = 1;
4628
4629 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
4630 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
4631}
4632
4633/*
4634 * Enable this only for specific OS versions, and only when they have repaired
4635 * their problems with it. Until then, this is is broken and needs to be
4636 * diabled by default. See RT22589 for details.
4637 */
4638#undef ENABLE_ACCEPTFILTER
4639
4640isc_result_t
4641isc_socket_filter(isc_socket_t *sock0, const char *filter) {
4642 isc__socket_t *sock = (isc__socket_t *)sock0;
4643#if defined(SO_ACCEPTFILTER) && defined(ENABLE_ACCEPTFILTER)
4644 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
4645 struct accept_filter_arg afa;
4646#else
4647 UNUSED(sock);
4648 UNUSED(filter);
4649#endif
4650
4651 REQUIRE(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
4652
4653#if defined(SO_ACCEPTFILTER) && defined(ENABLE_ACCEPTFILTER)
4654 bzero(&afa, sizeof(afa));
4655 strlcpy(afa.af_name, filter, sizeof(afa.af_name));
4656 if (setsockopt(sock->fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_ACCEPTFILTER,
4657 &afa, sizeof(afa)) == -1) {
4658 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
4659 socket_log(sock, NULL, CREATION,
4660 "setsockopt(SO_ACCEPTFILTER): %s", strbuf);
4661 return (ISC_R_FAILURE);
4662 }
4663 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
4664#else
4665 return (ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED);
4666#endif
4667}
4668
4669/*
4670 * Try enabling TCP Fast Open for a given socket if the OS supports it.
4671 */
4672static void
4673set_tcp_fastopen(isc__socket_t *sock, unsigned int backlog) {
4674#if defined(ENABLE_TCP_FASTOPEN) && defined(TCP_FASTOPEN)
4675 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
4676
4677/*
4678 * FreeBSD, as of versions 10.3 and 11.0, defines TCP_FASTOPEN while also
4679 * shipping a default kernel without TFO support, so we special-case it by
4680 * performing an additional runtime check for TFO support using sysctl to
4681 * prevent setsockopt() errors from being logged.
4682 */
4683#if defined(__FreeBSD__) && defined(HAVE_SYSCTLBYNAME)
4684#define SYSCTL_TFO "net.inet.tcp.fastopen.enabled"
4685 unsigned int enabled;
4686 size_t enabledlen = sizeof(enabled);
4687 static bool tfo_notice_logged = false;
4688
4689 if (sysctlbyname(SYSCTL_TFO, &enabled, &enabledlen, NULL, 0) < 0) {
4690 /*
4691 * This kernel does not support TCP Fast Open. There is
4692 * nothing more we can do.
4693 */
4694 return;
4695 } else if (enabled == 0) {
4696 /*
4697 * This kernel does support TCP Fast Open, but it is disabled
4698 * by sysctl. Notify the user, but do not nag.
4699 */
4700 if (!tfo_notice_logged) {
4701 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
4702 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
4703 "TCP_FASTOPEN support is disabled by "
4704 "sysctl (" SYSCTL_TFO " = 0)");
4705 tfo_notice_logged = true;
4706 }
4707 return;
4708 }
4709#endif
4710
4711#ifdef __APPLE__
4712 backlog = 1;
4713#else
4714 backlog = backlog / 2;
4715 if (backlog == 0)
4716 backlog = 1;
4717#endif
4718 if (setsockopt(sock->fd, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_FASTOPEN,
4719 (void *)&backlog, sizeof(backlog)) < 0) {
4720 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
4721 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
4722 "setsockopt(%d, TCP_FASTOPEN) failed with %s",
4723 sock->fd, strbuf);
4724 /* TCP_FASTOPEN is experimental so ignore failures */
4725 }
4726#else
4727 UNUSED(sock);
4728 UNUSED(backlog);
4729#endif
4730}
4731
4732/*
4733 * Set up to listen on a given socket. We do this by creating an internal
4734 * event that will be dispatched when the socket has read activity. The
4735 * watcher will send the internal event to the task when there is a new
4736 * connection.
4737 *
4738 * Unlike in read, we don't preallocate a done event here. Every time there
4739 * is a new connection we'll have to allocate a new one anyway, so we might
4740 * as well keep things simple rather than having to track them.
4741 */
4742isc_result_t
4743isc_socket_listen(isc_socket_t *sock0, unsigned int backlog) {
4744 isc__socket_t *sock = (isc__socket_t *)sock0;
4745 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
4746
4747 REQUIRE(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
4748
4749 LOCK(&sock->lock);
4750
4751 REQUIRE(!sock->listener);
4752 REQUIRE(sock->bound);
4753 REQUIRE(sock->type == isc_sockettype_tcp ||
4754 sock->type == isc_sockettype_unix);
4755
4756 if (backlog == 0)
4757 backlog = SOMAXCONN;
4758
4759 if (listen(sock->fd, (int)backlog) < 0) {
4760 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
4761 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
4762
4763 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__, "listen: %s", strbuf);
4764
4765 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
4766 }
4767
4768 set_tcp_fastopen(sock, backlog);
4769
4770 sock->listener = 1;
4771
4772 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
4773 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
4774}
4775
4776/*
4777 * This should try to do aggressive accept() XXXMLG
4778 */
4779isc_result_t
4780isc_socket_accept(isc_socket_t *sock0,
4781 isc_task_t *task, isc_taskaction_t action, void *arg)
4782{
4783 isc__socket_t *sock = (isc__socket_t *)sock0;
4784 isc_socket_newconnev_t *dev;
4785 isc__socketmgr_t *manager;
4786 isc_task_t *ntask = NULL;
4787 isc__socket_t *nsock;
4788 isc_result_t result;
4789 bool do_poke = false;
4790
4791 REQUIRE(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
4792 manager = sock->manager;
4793 REQUIRE(VALID_MANAGER(manager));
4794
4795 LOCK(&sock->lock);
4796
4797 REQUIRE(sock->listener);
4798
4799 /*
4800 * Sender field is overloaded here with the task we will be sending
4801 * this event to. Just before the actual event is delivered the
4802 * actual ev_sender will be touched up to be the socket.
4803 */
4804 dev = (isc_socket_newconnev_t *)
4805 isc_event_allocate(manager->mctx, task, ISC_SOCKEVENT_NEWCONN,
4806 action, arg, sizeof(*dev));
4807 if (dev == NULL) {
4808 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
4809 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
4810 }
4811 ISC_LINK_INIT(dev, ev_link);
4812
4813 result = allocate_socket(manager, sock->type, &nsock);
4814 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
4815 isc_event_free(ISC_EVENT_PTR(&dev));
4816 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
4817 return (result);
4818 }
4819
4820 /*
4821 * Attach to socket and to task.
4822 */
4823 isc_task_attach(task, &ntask);
4824 if (isc_task_exiting(ntask)) {
4825 free_socket(&nsock);
4826 isc_task_detach(&ntask);
4827 isc_event_free(ISC_EVENT_PTR(&dev));
4828 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
4829 return (ISC_R_SHUTTINGDOWN);
4830 }
4831 isc_refcount_increment(&nsock->references);
4832 nsock->statsindex = sock->statsindex;
4833
4834 dev->ev_sender = ntask;
4835 dev->newsocket = (isc_socket_t *)nsock;
4836
4837 /*
4838 * Poke watcher here. We still have the socket locked, so there
4839 * is no race condition. We will keep the lock for such a short
4840 * bit of time waking it up now or later won't matter all that much.
4841 */
4842 do_poke = ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->accept_list);
4843 ISC_LIST_ENQUEUE(sock->accept_list, dev, ev_link);
4844 if (do_poke) {
4845 select_poke(manager, sock->threadid, sock->fd,
4846 SELECT_POKE_ACCEPT);
4847 }
4848 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
4849 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
4850}
4851
4852isc_result_t
4853isc_socket_connect(isc_socket_t *sock0, const isc_sockaddr_t *addr,
4854 isc_task_t *task, isc_taskaction_t action, void *arg)
4855{
4856 isc__socket_t *sock = (isc__socket_t *)sock0;
4857 isc_socket_connev_t *dev;
4858 isc_task_t *ntask = NULL;
4859 isc__socketmgr_t *manager;
4860 int cc;
4861 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
4862 char addrbuf[ISC_SOCKADDR_FORMATSIZE];
4863
4864 REQUIRE(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
4865 REQUIRE(addr != NULL);
4866 REQUIRE(task != NULL);
4867 REQUIRE(action != NULL);
4868
4869 manager = sock->manager;
4870 REQUIRE(VALID_MANAGER(manager));
4871 REQUIRE(addr != NULL);
4872
4873 if (isc_sockaddr_ismulticast(addr))
4874 return (ISC_R_MULTICAST);
4875
4876 LOCK(&sock->lock);
4877
4878 dev = (isc_socket_connev_t *)isc_event_allocate(manager->mctx, sock,
4879 ISC_SOCKEVENT_CONNECT,
4880 action, arg,
4881 sizeof(*dev));
4882 if (dev == NULL) {
4883 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
4884 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
4885 }
4886 ISC_LINK_INIT(dev, ev_link);
4887
4888 if (sock->connecting) {
4889 INSIST(isc_sockaddr_equal(&sock->peer_address, addr));
4890 goto queue;
4891 }
4892
4893 if (sock->connected) {
4894 INSIST(isc_sockaddr_equal(&sock->peer_address, addr));
4895 dev->result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
4896 isc_task_sendto(task, ISC_EVENT_PTR(&dev), sock->threadid);
4897
4898 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
4899
4900 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
4901 }
4902
4903 /*
4904 * Try to do the connect right away, as there can be only one
4905 * outstanding, and it might happen to complete.
4906 */
4907 sock->peer_address = *addr;
4908 cc = connect(sock->fd, &addr->type.sa, addr->length);
4909 if (cc < 0) {
4910 /*
4911 * The socket is nonblocking and the connection cannot be
4912 * completed immediately. It is possible to select(2) or
4913 * poll(2) for completion by selecting the socket for writing.
4914 * After select(2) indicates writability, use getsockopt(2) to
4915 * read the SO_ERROR option at level SOL_SOCKET to determine
4916 * whether connect() completed successfully (SO_ERROR is zero)
4917 * or unsuccessfully (SO_ERROR is one of the usual error codes
4918 * listed here, explaining the reason for the failure).
4919 */
4920 if (sock->type == isc_sockettype_udp && errno == EINPROGRESS) {
4921 cc = 0;
4922 goto success;
4923 }
4924 if (SOFT_ERROR(errno) || errno == EINPROGRESS)
4925 goto queue;
4926
4927 switch (errno) {
4928#define ERROR_MATCH(a, b) case a: dev->result = b; goto err_exit;
4929 ERROR_MATCH(EACCES, ISC_R_NOPERM);
4930 ERROR_MATCH(EADDRNOTAVAIL, ISC_R_ADDRNOTAVAIL);
4931 ERROR_MATCH(EAFNOSUPPORT, ISC_R_ADDRNOTAVAIL);
4932 ERROR_MATCH(ECONNREFUSED, ISC_R_CONNREFUSED);
4933 ERROR_MATCH(EHOSTUNREACH, ISC_R_HOSTUNREACH);
4934#ifdef EHOSTDOWN
4935 ERROR_MATCH(EHOSTDOWN, ISC_R_HOSTUNREACH);
4936#endif
4937 ERROR_MATCH(ENETUNREACH, ISC_R_NETUNREACH);
4938 ERROR_MATCH(ENOBUFS, ISC_R_NORESOURCES);
4939 ERROR_MATCH(EPERM, ISC_R_HOSTUNREACH);
4940 ERROR_MATCH(EPIPE, ISC_R_NOTCONNECTED);
4941 ERROR_MATCH(ECONNRESET, ISC_R_CONNECTIONRESET);
4942#undef ERROR_MATCH
4943 }
4944
4945 sock->connected = 0;
4946
4947 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
4948 isc_sockaddr_format(addr, addrbuf, sizeof(addrbuf));
4949 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__, "connect(%s) %d/%s",
4950 addrbuf, errno, strbuf);
4951
4952 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
4953 inc_stats(sock->manager->stats,
4954 sock->statsindex[STATID_CONNECTFAIL]);
4955 isc_event_free(ISC_EVENT_PTR(&dev));
4956 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
4957
4958 err_exit:
4959 sock->connected = 0;
4960 isc_task_sendto(task, ISC_EVENT_PTR(&dev), sock->threadid);
4961
4962 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
4963 inc_stats(sock->manager->stats,
4964 sock->statsindex[STATID_CONNECTFAIL]);
4965 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
4966 }
4967
4968 /*
4969 * If connect completed, fire off the done event.
4970 */
4971 success:
4972 if (cc == 0) {
4973 sock->connected = 1;
4974 sock->bound = 1;
4975 dev->result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
4976 isc_task_sendto(task, ISC_EVENT_PTR(&dev), sock->threadid);
4977
4978 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
4979
4980 inc_stats(sock->manager->stats,
4981 sock->statsindex[STATID_CONNECT]);
4982
4983 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
4984 }
4985
4986 queue:
4987
4988 /*
4989 * Attach to task.
4990 */
4991 isc_task_attach(task, &ntask);
4992
4993 dev->ev_sender = ntask;
4994
4995 /*
4996 * Poke watcher here. We still have the socket locked, so there
4997 * is no race condition. We will keep the lock for such a short
4998 * bit of time waking it up now or later won't matter all that much.
4999 */
5000 bool do_poke = ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->connect_list);
5001 ISC_LIST_ENQUEUE(sock->connect_list, dev, ev_link);
5002 if (do_poke && !sock->connecting) {
5003 sock->connecting = 1;
5004 select_poke(manager, sock->threadid, sock->fd,
5005 SELECT_POKE_CONNECT);
5006 }
5007
5008 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
5009 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
5010}
5011
5012/*
5013 * Called when a socket with a pending connect() finishes.
5014 */
5015static void
5016internal_connect(isc__socket_t *sock) {
5017 isc_socket_connev_t *dev;
5018 int cc;
5019 isc_result_t result;
5020 socklen_t optlen;
5021 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
5022 char peerbuf[ISC_SOCKADDR_FORMATSIZE];
5023
5024 INSIST(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
5025
5026 LOCK(&sock->lock);
5027
5028 /*
5029 * Get the first item off the connect list.
5030 * If it is empty, unlock the socket and return.
5031 */
5032 dev = ISC_LIST_HEAD(sock->connect_list);
5033 if (dev == NULL) {
5034 INSIST(!sock->connecting);
5035 goto finish;
5036 }
5037
5038 INSIST(sock->connecting);
5039 sock->connecting = 0;
5040
5041 /*
5042 * Get any possible error status here.
5043 */
5044 optlen = sizeof(cc);
5045 if (getsockopt(sock->fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_ERROR,
5046 (void *)&cc, (void *)&optlen) != 0)
5047 cc = errno;
5048 else
5049 errno = cc;
5050
5051 if (errno != 0) {
5052 /*
5053 * If the error is EAGAIN, just re-select on this
5054 * fd and pretend nothing strange happened.
5055 */
5056 if (SOFT_ERROR(errno) || errno == EINPROGRESS) {
5057 sock->connecting = 1;
5058 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
5059 return;
5060 }
5061
5062 inc_stats(sock->manager->stats,
5063 sock->statsindex[STATID_CONNECTFAIL]);
5064
5065 /*
5066 * Translate other errors into ISC_R_* flavors.
5067 */
5068 switch (errno) {
5069#define ERROR_MATCH(a, b) case a: result = b; break;
5070 ERROR_MATCH(EACCES, ISC_R_NOPERM);
5071 ERROR_MATCH(EADDRNOTAVAIL, ISC_R_ADDRNOTAVAIL);
5072 ERROR_MATCH(EAFNOSUPPORT, ISC_R_ADDRNOTAVAIL);
5073 ERROR_MATCH(ECONNREFUSED, ISC_R_CONNREFUSED);
5074 ERROR_MATCH(EHOSTUNREACH, ISC_R_HOSTUNREACH);
5075#ifdef EHOSTDOWN
5076 ERROR_MATCH(EHOSTDOWN, ISC_R_HOSTUNREACH);
5077#endif
5078 ERROR_MATCH(ENETUNREACH, ISC_R_NETUNREACH);
5079 ERROR_MATCH(ENOBUFS, ISC_R_NORESOURCES);
5080 ERROR_MATCH(EPERM, ISC_R_HOSTUNREACH);
5081 ERROR_MATCH(EPIPE, ISC_R_NOTCONNECTED);
5082 ERROR_MATCH(ETIMEDOUT, ISC_R_TIMEDOUT);
5083 ERROR_MATCH(ECONNRESET, ISC_R_CONNECTIONRESET);
5084#undef ERROR_MATCH
5085 default:
5086 result = ISC_R_UNEXPECTED;
5087 isc_sockaddr_format(&sock->peer_address, peerbuf,
5088 sizeof(peerbuf));
5089 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
5090 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
5091 "internal_connect: connect(%s) %s",
5092 peerbuf, strbuf);
5093 }
5094 } else {
5095 inc_stats(sock->manager->stats,
5096 sock->statsindex[STATID_CONNECT]);
5097 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
5098 sock->connected = 1;
5099 sock->bound = 1;
5100 }
5101
5102 do {
5103 dev->result = result;
5104 send_connectdone_event(sock, &dev);
5105 dev = ISC_LIST_HEAD(sock->connect_list);
5106 } while (dev != NULL);
5107
5108 finish:
5109 unwatch_fd(&sock->manager->threads[sock->threadid], sock->fd,
5110 SELECT_POKE_CONNECT);
5111
5112 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
5113}
5114
5115isc_result_t
5116isc_socket_getpeername(isc_socket_t *sock0, isc_sockaddr_t *addressp) {
5117 isc__socket_t *sock = (isc__socket_t *)sock0;
5118 isc_result_t result;
5119
5120 REQUIRE(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
5121 REQUIRE(addressp != NULL);
5122
5123 LOCK(&sock->lock);
5124
5125 if (sock->connected) {
5126 *addressp = sock->peer_address;
5127 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
5128 } else {
5129 result = ISC_R_NOTCONNECTED;
5130 }
5131
5132 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
5133
5134 return (result);
5135}
5136
5137isc_result_t
5138isc_socket_getsockname(isc_socket_t *sock0, isc_sockaddr_t *addressp) {
5139 isc__socket_t *sock = (isc__socket_t *)sock0;
5140 socklen_t len;
5141 isc_result_t result;
5142 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
5143
5144 REQUIRE(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
5145 REQUIRE(addressp != NULL);
5146
5147 LOCK(&sock->lock);
5148
5149 if (!sock->bound) {
5150 result = ISC_R_NOTBOUND;
5151 goto out;
5152 }
5153
5154 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
5155
5156 len = sizeof(addressp->type);
5157 if (getsockname(sock->fd, &addressp->type.sa, (void *)&len) < 0) {
5158 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
5159 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__, "getsockname: %s",
5160 strbuf);
5161 result = ISC_R_UNEXPECTED;
5162 goto out;
5163 }
5164 addressp->length = (unsigned int)len;
5165
5166 out:
5167 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
5168
5169 return (result);
5170}
5171
5172/*
5173 * Run through the list of events on this socket, and cancel the ones
5174 * queued for task "task" of type "how". "how" is a bitmask.
5175 */
5176void
5177isc_socket_cancel(isc_socket_t *sock0, isc_task_t *task, unsigned int how) {
5178 isc__socket_t *sock = (isc__socket_t *)sock0;
5179
5180 REQUIRE(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
5181
5182 /*
5183 * Quick exit if there is nothing to do. Don't even bother locking
5184 * in this case.
5185 */
5186 if (how == 0)
5187 return;
5188
5189 LOCK(&sock->lock);
5190
5191 /*
5192 * All of these do the same thing, more or less.
5193 * Each will:
5194 * o If the internal event is marked as "posted" try to
5195 * remove it from the task's queue. If this fails, mark it
5196 * as canceled instead, and let the task clean it up later.
5197 * o For each I/O request for that task of that type, post
5198 * its done event with status of "ISC_R_CANCELED".
5199 * o Reset any state needed.
5200 */
5201 if (((how & ISC_SOCKCANCEL_RECV) != 0)
5202 && !ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->recv_list)) {
5203 isc_socketevent_t *dev;
5204 isc_socketevent_t *next;
5205 isc_task_t *current_task;
5206
5207 dev = ISC_LIST_HEAD(sock->recv_list);
5208
5209 while (dev != NULL) {
5210 current_task = dev->ev_sender;
5211 next = ISC_LIST_NEXT(dev, ev_link);
5212
5213 if ((task == NULL) || (task == current_task)) {
5214 dev->result = ISC_R_CANCELED;
5215 send_recvdone_event(sock, &dev);
5216 }
5217 dev = next;
5218 }
5219 }
5220
5221 if (((how & ISC_SOCKCANCEL_SEND) != 0)
5222 && !ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->send_list)) {
5223 isc_socketevent_t *dev;
5224 isc_socketevent_t *next;
5225 isc_task_t *current_task;
5226
5227 dev = ISC_LIST_HEAD(sock->send_list);
5228
5229 while (dev != NULL) {
5230 current_task = dev->ev_sender;
5231 next = ISC_LIST_NEXT(dev, ev_link);
5232
5233 if ((task == NULL) || (task == current_task)) {
5234 dev->result = ISC_R_CANCELED;
5235 send_senddone_event(sock, &dev);
5236 }
5237 dev = next;
5238 }
5239 }
5240
5241 if (((how & ISC_SOCKCANCEL_ACCEPT) != 0)
5242 && !ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->accept_list)) {
5243 isc_socket_newconnev_t *dev;
5244 isc_socket_newconnev_t *next;
5245 isc_task_t *current_task;
5246
5247 dev = ISC_LIST_HEAD(sock->accept_list);
5248 while (dev != NULL) {
5249 current_task = dev->ev_sender;
5250 next = ISC_LIST_NEXT(dev, ev_link);
5251
5252 if ((task == NULL) || (task == current_task)) {
5253
5254 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(sock->accept_list, dev,
5255 ev_link);
5256
5257 NEWCONNSOCK(dev)->references--;
5258 free_socket((isc__socket_t **)&dev->newsocket);
5259
5260 dev->result = ISC_R_CANCELED;
5261 dev->ev_sender = sock;
5262 isc_task_sendtoanddetach(&current_task,
5263 ISC_EVENT_PTR(&dev), sock->threadid);
5264 }
5265
5266 dev = next;
5267 }
5268 }
5269
5270 if (((how & ISC_SOCKCANCEL_CONNECT) != 0)
5271 && !ISC_LIST_EMPTY(sock->connect_list)) {
5272 isc_socket_connev_t *dev;
5273 isc_socket_connev_t *next;
5274 isc_task_t *current_task;
5275
5276 INSIST(sock->connecting);
5277 sock->connecting = 0;
5278
5279 dev = ISC_LIST_HEAD(sock->connect_list);
5280
5281 while (dev != NULL) {
5282 current_task = dev->ev_sender;
5283 next = ISC_LIST_NEXT(dev, ev_link);
5284
5285 if ((task == NULL) || (task == current_task)) {
5286 dev->result = ISC_R_CANCELED;
5287 send_connectdone_event(sock, &dev);
5288 }
5289 dev = next;
5290 }
5291 }
5292
5293 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
5294}
5295
5296isc_sockettype_t
5297isc_socket_gettype(isc_socket_t *sock0) {
5298 isc__socket_t *sock = (isc__socket_t *)sock0;
5299
5300 REQUIRE(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
5301
5302 return (sock->type);
5303}
5304
5305void
5306isc_socket_ipv6only(isc_socket_t *sock0, bool yes) {
5307 isc__socket_t *sock = (isc__socket_t *)sock0;
5308#if defined(IPV6_V6ONLY)
5309 int onoff = yes ? 1 : 0;
5310#else
5311 UNUSED(yes);
5312 UNUSED(sock);
5313#endif
5314
5315 REQUIRE(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
5316 INSIST(!sock->dupped);
5317
5318#ifdef IPV6_V6ONLY
5319 if (sock->pf == AF_INET6) {
5320 if (setsockopt(sock->fd, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_V6ONLY,
5321 (void *)&onoff, sizeof(int)) < 0) {
5322 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
5323 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
5324 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
5325 "setsockopt(%d, IPV6_V6ONLY) failed: %s",
5326 sock->fd, strbuf);
5327 }
5328 }
5329#endif
5330}
5331
5332static void
5333setdscp(isc__socket_t *sock, isc_dscp_t dscp) {
5334#if defined(IP_TOS) || defined(IPV6_TCLASS)
5335 int value = dscp << 2;
5336#endif
5337
5338 sock->dscp = dscp;
5339
5340#ifdef IP_TOS
5341 if (sock->pf == AF_INET) {
5342 if (setsockopt(sock->fd, IPPROTO_IP, IP_TOS,
5343 (void *)&value, sizeof(value)) < 0) {
5344 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
5345 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
5346 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
5347 "setsockopt(%d, IP_TOS, %.02x) failed: %s",
5348 sock->fd, value >> 2,
5349 strbuf);
5350 }
5351 }
5352#endif
5353#ifdef IPV6_TCLASS
5354 if (sock->pf == AF_INET6) {
5355 if (setsockopt(sock->fd, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_TCLASS,
5356 (void *)&value, sizeof(value)) < 0) {
5357 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
5358 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
5359 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
5360 "setsockopt(%d, IPV6_TCLASS, %.02x) failed: %s",
5361 sock->fd, dscp >> 2, strbuf);
5362 }
5363 }
5364#endif
5365}
5366
5367void
5368isc_socket_dscp(isc_socket_t *sock0, isc_dscp_t dscp) {
5369 isc__socket_t *sock = (isc__socket_t *)sock0;
5370
5371 REQUIRE(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
5372 REQUIRE(dscp < 0x40);
5373
5374#if !defined(IP_TOS) && !defined(IPV6_TCLASS)
5375 UNUSED(dscp);
5376#else
5377 if (dscp < 0)
5378 return;
5379
5380 /* The DSCP value must not be changed once it has been set. */
5381 if (isc_dscp_check_value != -1)
5382 INSIST(dscp == isc_dscp_check_value);
5383#endif
5384
5385
5386#ifdef notyet
5387 REQUIRE(!sock->dupped);
5388#endif
5389
5390 setdscp(sock, dscp);
5391}

5402isc_socket_setname(isc_socket_t *socket0, const char *name, void *tag) {

5406 * Name 'sock'.
5407 */
5408

5410

5412 strlcpy(sock->name, name, sizeof(sock->name));
5413 sock->tag = tag;

5415}

5437
5438static isc_once_t hasreuseport_once = ISC_ONCE_INIT;
5439static bool hasreuseport = false;
5440
5441static void
5442init_hasreuseport(void) {
5443/*
5444 * SO_REUSEPORT works very differently on *BSD and on Linux (because why not).
5445 * We only want to use it on Linux, if it's available. On BSD we want to dup()
5446 * sockets instead of re-binding them.
5447 */
5448#if defined(SO_REUSEPORT) && defined(__linux__)
5449 int sock, yes = 1;
5450 sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
5451 if (sock < 0) {
5452 sock = socket(AF_INET6, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
5453 if (sock < 0) {
5454 return;
5455 }
5456 }
5457 if (setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR,
5458 (void *)&yes, sizeof(yes)) < 0)
5459 {
5460 close(sock);
5461 return;
5462 } else if (setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEPORT,
5463 (void *)&yes, sizeof(yes)) < 0)
5464 {
5465 close(sock);
5466 return;
5467 }
5468 hasreuseport = true;
5469 close(sock);
5470#endif
5471}
5472
5473bool
5474isc_socket_hasreuseport() {
5475 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_once_do(&hasreuseport_once, init_hasreuseport)
5476 == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
5477 return (hasreuseport);
5478}

5481#if defined(HAVE_LIBXML2) || defined(HAVE_JSON)
5482static const char *
5483_socktype(isc_sockettype_t type)
5484{
5485 switch (type) {
5486 case isc_sockettype_udp:
5487 return ("udp");
5488 case isc_sockettype_tcp:
5489 return ("tcp");
5490 case isc_sockettype_unix:
5491 return ("unix");
5492 case isc_sockettype_fdwatch:
5493 return ("fdwatch");
5494 default:
5495 return ("not-initialized");
5496 }
5497}
5498#endif
5499
5500#ifdef HAVE_LIBXML2
5501#define TRY0(a) do { xmlrc = (a); if (xmlrc < 0) goto error; } while(/*CONSTCOND*/0)
5502int
5503isc_socketmgr_renderxml(isc_socketmgr_t *mgr0, xmlTextWriterPtr writer) {
5504 isc__socketmgr_t *mgr = (isc__socketmgr_t *)mgr0;
5505 isc__socket_t *sock = NULL;
5506 char peerbuf[ISC_SOCKADDR_FORMATSIZE];
5507 isc_sockaddr_t addr;
5508 socklen_t len;
5509 int xmlrc;
5510
5511 LOCK(&mgr->lock);
5512
5513 TRY0(xmlTextWriterStartElement(writer, ISC_XMLCHAR "sockets"));
5514 sock = ISC_LIST_HEAD(mgr->socklist);
5515 while (sock != NULL) {
5516 LOCK(&sock->lock);
5517 TRY0(xmlTextWriterStartElement(writer, ISC_XMLCHAR "socket"));
5518
5519 TRY0(xmlTextWriterStartElement(writer, ISC_XMLCHAR "id"));
5520 TRY0(xmlTextWriterWriteFormatString(writer, "%p", sock));
5521 TRY0(xmlTextWriterEndElement(writer));
5522
5523 if (sock->name[0] != 0) {
5524 TRY0(xmlTextWriterStartElement(writer,
5525 ISC_XMLCHAR "name"));
5526 TRY0(xmlTextWriterWriteFormatString(writer, "%s",
5527 sock->name));
5528 TRY0(xmlTextWriterEndElement(writer)); /* name */
5529 }
5530
5531 TRY0(xmlTextWriterStartElement(writer,
5532 ISC_XMLCHAR "references"));
5533 TRY0(xmlTextWriterWriteFormatString(writer, "%d",
5534 (int)isc_refcount_current(&sock->references)));
5535 TRY0(xmlTextWriterEndElement(writer));
5536
5537 TRY0(xmlTextWriterWriteElement(writer, ISC_XMLCHAR "type",
5538 ISC_XMLCHAR _socktype(sock->type)));
5539
5540 if (sock->connected) {
5541 isc_sockaddr_format(&sock->peer_address, peerbuf,
5542 sizeof(peerbuf));
5543 TRY0(xmlTextWriterWriteElement(writer,
5544 ISC_XMLCHAR "peer-address",
5545 ISC_XMLCHAR peerbuf));
5546 }
5547
5548 len = sizeof(addr);
5549 if (getsockname(sock->fd, &addr.type.sa, (void *)&len) == 0) {
5550 isc_sockaddr_format(&addr, peerbuf, sizeof(peerbuf));
5551 TRY0(xmlTextWriterWriteElement(writer,
5552 ISC_XMLCHAR "local-address",
5553 ISC_XMLCHAR peerbuf));
5554 }
5555
5556 TRY0(xmlTextWriterStartElement(writer, ISC_XMLCHAR "states"));
5557 if (sock->listener)
5558 TRY0(xmlTextWriterWriteElement(writer,
5559 ISC_XMLCHAR "state",
5560 ISC_XMLCHAR "listener"));
5561 if (sock->connected)
5562 TRY0(xmlTextWriterWriteElement(writer,
5563 ISC_XMLCHAR "state",
5564 ISC_XMLCHAR "connected"));
5565 if (sock->connecting)
5566 TRY0(xmlTextWriterWriteElement(writer,
5567 ISC_XMLCHAR "state",
5568 ISC_XMLCHAR "connecting"));
5569 if (sock->bound)
5570 TRY0(xmlTextWriterWriteElement(writer,
5571 ISC_XMLCHAR "state",
5572 ISC_XMLCHAR "bound"));
5573
5574 TRY0(xmlTextWriterEndElement(writer)); /* states */
5575
5576 TRY0(xmlTextWriterEndElement(writer)); /* socket */
5577
5578 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
5579 sock = ISC_LIST_NEXT(sock, link);
5580 }
5581 TRY0(xmlTextWriterEndElement(writer)); /* sockets */
5582
5583 error:
5584 if (sock != NULL)
5585 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
5586
5587 UNLOCK(&mgr->lock);
5588
5589 return (xmlrc);
5590}
5591#endif /* HAVE_LIBXML2 */
5592
5593#ifdef HAVE_JSON
5594#define CHECKMEM(m) do { \
5595 if (m == NULL) { \
5596 result = ISC_R_NOMEMORY;\
5597 goto error;\
5598 } \
5599} while(/*CONSTCOND*/0)
5600
5601isc_result_t
5602isc_socketmgr_renderjson(isc_socketmgr_t *mgr0, json_object *stats) {
5603 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
5604 isc__socketmgr_t *mgr = (isc__socketmgr_t *)mgr0;
5605 isc__socket_t *sock = NULL;
5606 char peerbuf[ISC_SOCKADDR_FORMATSIZE];
5607 isc_sockaddr_t addr;
5608 socklen_t len;
5609 json_object *obj, *array = json_object_new_array();
5610
5611 CHECKMEM(array);
5612
5613 LOCK(&mgr->lock);
5614
5615 sock = ISC_LIST_HEAD(mgr->socklist);
5616 while (sock != NULL) {
5617 json_object *states, *entry = json_object_new_object();
5618 char buf[255];
5619
5620 CHECKMEM(entry);
5621 json_object_array_add(array, entry);
5622
5623 LOCK(&sock->lock);
5624
5625 snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "%p", sock);
5626 obj = json_object_new_string(buf);
5627 CHECKMEM(obj);
5628 json_object_object_add(entry, "id", obj);
5629
5630 if (sock->name[0] != 0) {
5631 obj = json_object_new_string(sock->name);
5632 CHECKMEM(obj);
5633 json_object_object_add(entry, "name", obj);
5634 }
5635
5636 obj = json_object_new_int(
5637 (int)isc_refcount_current(&sock->references));
5638 CHECKMEM(obj);
5639 json_object_object_add(entry, "references", obj);
5640
5641 obj = json_object_new_string(_socktype(sock->type));
5642 CHECKMEM(obj);
5643 json_object_object_add(entry, "type", obj);
5644
5645 if (sock->connected) {
5646 isc_sockaddr_format(&sock->peer_address, peerbuf,
5647 sizeof(peerbuf));
5648 obj = json_object_new_string(peerbuf);
5649 CHECKMEM(obj);
5650 json_object_object_add(entry, "peer-address", obj);
5651 }
5652
5653 len = sizeof(addr);
5654 if (getsockname(sock->fd, &addr.type.sa, (void *)&len) == 0) {
5655 isc_sockaddr_format(&addr, peerbuf, sizeof(peerbuf));
5656 obj = json_object_new_string(peerbuf);
5657 CHECKMEM(obj);
5658 json_object_object_add(entry, "local-address", obj);
5659 }
5660
5661 states = json_object_new_array();
5662 CHECKMEM(states);
5663 json_object_object_add(entry, "states", states);
5664
5665 if (sock->listener) {
5666 obj = json_object_new_string("listener");
5667 CHECKMEM(obj);
5668 json_object_array_add(states, obj);
5669 }
5670
5671 if (sock->connected) {
5672 obj = json_object_new_string("connected");
5673 CHECKMEM(obj);
5674 json_object_array_add(states, obj);
5675 }
5676
5677 if (sock->connecting) {
5678 obj = json_object_new_string("connecting");
5679 CHECKMEM(obj);
5680 json_object_array_add(states, obj);
5681 }
5682
5683 if (sock->bound) {
5684 obj = json_object_new_string("bound");
5685 CHECKMEM(obj);
5686 json_object_array_add(states, obj);
5687 }
5688
5689 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
5690 sock = ISC_LIST_NEXT(sock, link);
5691 }
5692
5693 json_object_object_add(stats, "sockets", array);
5694 array = NULL;
5695 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
5696
5697 error:
5698 if (array != NULL)
5699 json_object_put(array);
5700
5701 if (sock != NULL)
5702 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
5703
5704 UNLOCK(&mgr->lock);
5705
5706 return (result);
5707}
5708#endif /* HAVE_JSON */

5710isc_result_t
5711isc_socketmgr_createinctx(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_appctx_t *actx,
5712 isc_socketmgr_t **managerp)
5713{

5716 result = isc_socketmgr_create(mctx, managerp);
5717

5719 isc_appctx_setsocketmgr(actx, *managerp);

5723
5724/*
5725 * Create a new 'type' socket managed by 'manager'. Events
5726 * will be posted to 'task' and when dispatched 'action' will be
5727 * called with 'arg' as the arg value. The new socket is returned
5728 * in 'socketp'.
5729 */
5730isc_result_t
5731isc_socket_fdwatchcreate(isc_socketmgr_t *manager0, int fd, int flags,
5732 isc_sockfdwatch_t callback, void *cbarg,
5733 isc_task_t *task, isc_socket_t **socketp)
5734{
5735 isc__socketmgr_t *manager = (isc__socketmgr_t *)manager0;
5736 isc__socket_t *sock = NULL;
5737 isc__socketthread_t *thread;
5738 isc_result_t result;
5739 int lockid;
5740
5741 REQUIRE(VALID_MANAGER(manager));
5742 REQUIRE(socketp != NULL && *socketp == NULL);
5743
5744 if (fd < 0 || (unsigned int)fd >= manager->maxsocks)
5745 return (ISC_R_RANGE);
5746
5747 result = allocate_socket(manager, isc_sockettype_fdwatch, &sock);
5748 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
5749 return (result);
5750
5751 sock->fd = fd;
5752 sock->fdwatcharg = cbarg;
5753 sock->fdwatchcb = callback;
5754 sock->fdwatchflags = flags;
5755 sock->fdwatchtask = task;
5756
5757 sock->threadid = gen_threadid(sock);
5758 isc_refcount_init(&sock->references, 1);
5759 thread = &manager->threads[sock->threadid];
5760 *socketp = (isc_socket_t *)sock;
5761
5762 /*
5763 * Note we don't have to lock the socket like we normally would because
5764 * there are no external references to it yet.
5765 */
5766
5767 lockid = FDLOCK_ID(sock->fd);
5768 LOCK(&thread->fdlock[lockid]);
5769 thread->fds[sock->fd] = sock;
5770 thread->fdstate[sock->fd] = MANAGED;
5771
5772#if defined(USE_EPOLL)
5773 manager->epoll_events[sock->fd] = 0;
5774#endif
5775 UNLOCK(&thread->fdlock[lockid]);
5776
5777 LOCK(&manager->lock);
5778 ISC_LIST_APPEND(manager->socklist, sock, link);
5779#ifdef USE_SELECT
5780 if (manager->maxfd < sock->fd)
5781 manager->maxfd = sock->fd;
5782#endif
5783 UNLOCK(&manager->lock);
5784
5785 sock->active = 1;
5786 if (flags & ISC_SOCKFDWATCH_READ)
5787 select_poke(sock->manager, sock->threadid, sock->fd,
5788 SELECT_POKE_READ);
5789 if (flags & ISC_SOCKFDWATCH_WRITE)
5790 select_poke(sock->manager, sock->threadid, sock->fd,
5791 SELECT_POKE_WRITE);
5792
5793 socket_log(sock, NULL, CREATION, "fdwatch-created");
5794
5795 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
5796}
5797
5798/*
5799 * Indicate to the manager that it should watch the socket again.
5800 * This can be used to restart watching if the previous event handler
5801 * didn't indicate there was more data to be processed. Primarily
5802 * it is for writing but could be used for reading if desired
5803 */
5804
5805isc_result_t
5806isc_socket_fdwatchpoke(isc_socket_t *sock0, int flags)
5807{
5808 isc__socket_t *sock = (isc__socket_t *)sock0;
5809
5810 REQUIRE(VALID_SOCKET(sock));
5811
5812 /*
5813 * We check both flags first to allow us to get the lock
5814 * once but only if we need it.
5815 */
5816
5817 if ((flags & (ISC_SOCKFDWATCH_READ | ISC_SOCKFDWATCH_WRITE)) != 0) {
5818 LOCK(&sock->lock);
5819 if ((flags & ISC_SOCKFDWATCH_READ) != 0)
5820 select_poke(sock->manager, sock->threadid, sock->fd,
5821 SELECT_POKE_READ);
5822 if ((flags & ISC_SOCKFDWATCH_WRITE) != 0)
5823 select_poke(sock->manager, sock->threadid, sock->fd,
5824 SELECT_POKE_WRITE);
5825 UNLOCK(&sock->lock);
5826 }
5827
5828 socket_log(sock, NULL, TRACE, "fdwatch-poked flags: %d", flags);
5829
5830 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
5831}
